AJW5blwtAWGutZ3N5fEewA.text: English muffin for Commuter Sandwich is closer to a Bialy or Roll.   Friendly and prompt service.

hs8bjd-isP0yd3zDeDBAiA.text: Beware. Lousy food at a high price!!! What do you expect for airport food hu?  The burger was Raw, the chicken wrap turned out to be a "chickpea" wrap????  Ugggghh. And the fries have pepper on them. Thanks but no thanks I can do it my self IF I WANTED stupid PEPPER on them!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NZsw_diTpLtXdIV-nH0Esg.text: Worst espresso I've had in years. Ordered a double, and it barely cornered the bottom of the cup. Very, very bitter.   Purchased a kale salad to take on the flight; it was tasty and nutritious.

2BAdbyABYskAjof98Xtxmg.text: So awesome that La Grande Orange is at terminal 4.  I love that terminal 4 has the best of the best of PHX local restaurants.  What an awesome surprise.  I have always enjoyed La Grange Orange their great salads, sandwiches, great pizza selections and reasonably prices on beer and wine.  You can't go wrong grabbing something great to eat prior to catching your flight.    LGO -great food & great service!

yxMRDqyKOb580lTuxOBcIw.text: Such a cool alternative to the standard food at an airport.  Excellent coffee and the pastries are INSANE!  Make sure you walk past Peete's if you want coffee, this place is way better.  Not my favorite for actual meals like sandwiches and stuff, but they handle it for breakfast

S66I4YRfW0wFV3iTmwS6IQ.text: I didn't have much time to enjoy. Just a quick bite/salad before my flight. It was a good tide-me-over till I get home. Tasty!!

jeJJ_kJpfgKVXz-jr1aMOA.text: Ordered the scrambled eggs, fruit, and toast. I should've know better. Crappy eggs, a hunk of not ripe pineapple, and cold dry toast. Not worth the almost $7. Learned my lesson...  Upgraded to 3 stars because they reached out to me based on my review and seem to genuinely care. I appreciate their time and effort to improve.

YT1dRAfns81b1k87bp5gbw.text: I had a 2:30 flight out of Phoenix and was pressed for time so I didn't have a chance to stop for lunch before heading to the airport. Once I managed to get through security, I headed to my gate to look at my options and they really were limited so I selected La Grande Orange since they had a pretty diverse selection and seemed somewhat reasonably priced.  My biggest complaint with La Grande Orange was the layout. There are several stations, one for pizza another for the bakery and another for sandwiches however there are four registers spaced out. I assumed that you could only order near the station you were ordering from, I was wrong so was everyone else and it caused a bit of confusion. The process is pretty simple once you get to a register, you place your order and will be called when your order is ready. I and ordered a pizza, which at $12 it was was reasonably priced considering many other options. I waited about 15+ minutes for my pizza which wasn't too bad since the terminal was pretty crowded.  Overall it was a decent option, but nothing to go crazy about.

VdPzdL3IpC_IEYpeVfuJog.text: I think their Kale & Quinoa salad is the best salad I've ever had in an airport. Might be one of the best salads I've had, period! Kale is so chock-full of vitamins, but sometimes it's so darn tough. This kale was  tender and thinly shredded; topped w/ nutty quinoa, chopped red bell pepper, sunflower seeds, grapes, shredded Reggio cheese, and a tangy, lemony-garlicky dressing. Very generous portion, too.  I was at the farthest possible gate away (A-30), but had an hour between flights, so took a brisk walk through Terminals A, B, and C until I finally got to D. My FitBit clocked it at 1 mile each way, but totally worth it. Got 2 miles of Excercise AND an amazing salad. Can I create this salad at home? I'm going to try!  They have other great-sounding salads, sandwiches, burgers, pizzas, desserts, coffee, drinks, wine and beer, too. This will be a must-stop on any future trips through the Phoenix airport!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale and Quinoa salad - got a little mixed up on the walk back to Terminal A, but still delicious!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Grande Orange - great fast, healthy airport food!

a6NioyJARDxffBQdQyOkZA.text: Order a pizza or a kale salad with salmon. Actual order anything here and you'll be a happy camper. This is a must stop food option in the D Terminal at Sky Harbor. If you're a local Phoenician and have never been to their restaurant in the Phoenix area...it's also very cool.   Traveller Tip: The airport ordering feels a little crazy at times when they're busy. The flow isn't quite clear unless they have an employee handing out menus. Pizzas take 15ish & are enough for 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother Earth!! Yes, please!!!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza to go!

970PuS35WOdIopJQjFLMsQ.text: Had the chick pea lettuce wrap. As a vegan, I greatly appreciated the option. Super favorable and maybe a touch more spicy than I would want.

4ifC4Q3p6k9Nq4igA1yZ7A.text: I found this gluten free spot from the phx website skyharbor.com. I ordered a gluten free Mother Earth pizza that was quite delicious! The crust was a little crunchy like flatbread but the cheese and toppings made up for it big time! The food was also prepared professionally and quickly! The pizza person was extremely helpful and friendly. I now know where to get good grub in the airport. And the price was quite alright at $13 for a small gluten free with like 10 toppings!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Mother Earth pizza gluten free!

2Dgce1aVwKSWC-DhyafPDg.text: Ordered a pizza which was tasty but a bit greasy. The service was fast, though, which is what I wanted from an airport place. Looked to be a broad selection of menu items. I'd definitely return if I travel through PHX.

TU-2_NSEFYv1dHJrwIV3Jw.text: Absolutely love the feel and the food selection at this place!  Beat gluten free pizza .. amazing for the airport

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. More of the fab team!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The fabulous team at La Grande Orange ..
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mother Earth gluten free pizza.. amazing!!!

R-gsTsvesC5C2rZStpI9yg.text: I had an hour before my flight and needed something to eat. This place looked quick. They have an extensive menu so there will hopefully be something you'll like. I got the guacamole BLT. What a perfect combination of flavors and textures;  e.g. -the crispiness of the bacon and the toasted bread -the freshness of the lettuce and tomatoes -and dat powerful punch from the holy guacamole  Not a bad choice for eating at the airport.

OTSR3kZeApYXNT7r2S75AQ.text: I enter the airport and get done going through security. It's about 30 mins before my plane departs. I run to Gates D because I know La Grange Orange is there. I LOVE the salads so much here, I have one of those punch cards.  I run here, order my faves: 1. Smoked Turkey Salad 2. Cobb Salad 3. Kale and Quinoa Salad   I don't care if each salad is about $10. I'll order two of then because they are done so well! This place has made me picky about quality of my salads.   In the last couple of months I've been cutting it close getting to board my plane because I gotta run to Gates D to get to La Grande Orange, then board my plane in Gates C. Today, I was ready. I had my Brooks running shoes on, and in my work out gear. I ran to get 2 salads then ran to board my plane. I was a happy camper on my flight and ready to jet off to my destination!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cdDsQ5ptXiuFg0J_Tew0wg.text: Yesterday I purchased a "brownie" from the cafe. It was not described any other way but simply "brownie". It was the most un-enjoyable brownie I've ever had.   It's kind of dry and chewy, with a strong alcohol flavor that's not matched well with whatever chocolate they use. They also top it with salt, and the brownie is not sweet enough to counter the salt flavor. So what you basically end up with is an offensive bitter square with a boozy salty flavor. It's not yummy and I would trash the recipe and start over.   If I could get my money back I would.

O_uK4Lljf8LUu_b9lL-tig.text: One of the best restaurants in any airport in the U.S.! La Grande Orange has a little bit of everything. I always make a beeline for this place, which is about 3 times a month. I am in love with their kale, quinoa salad! Their chickpea salad is also very good and extremely healthy. Their pizzas and sandwiches are also excellent choices. Their dessert options are something to admire; they offer mini ding dongs and also mini cookies for those of us that are watching our weight, but still want to indulge a little. The ingredients are always fresh and the prices are very reasonable. While there are other tasty options in PHX SkyHarbor Airport, nothing is as good as La Grande Orange.

ARS4_va3KhvLtEtU5D2yhA.text: We were nervous bringing a group since they don't take reservations, but had no problem on a Monday night. The tall community table was perfect for our group of 8. While other places frown upon holding seats (ahem, B&T), the waitstaff immediately put out water glasses to hold places until the rest of our friends arrived. Cocktails at happy hour are a smoking deal! $5 for a fabulous Greenpoint- generous pour, nice glass, single big cube. Our server had the kitchen split the yummy salad that B and I shared onto two plates (nice touch!). We also shared the "Mother Earth" pizza. Good amount of veggie toppings, but needed a little salt and spice for me. Our server was really amazing. She explained the HH deals multiple times, helped us get in one more round before it ended, and then split a very complicated itemized bill between 4 parties. She went above and beyond! Parking is limited, but the complimentary valet is speedy.

QQyO5N4UfNjJTFNeBpPncw.text: This was always a great place to get lunch, when i was working at Skye Harbor Airport. It was a hike for me coming from the US Airways A gates; all the way over to La Grande Orange which is at the very end of the concourse.(by South West airlines). But it was so worth it.My go to choices were " the commuter breakfast sandwhich" ,  the "kale quinoa salad" or the chickpea salad.  The commuter sandwhich has egg tomatoe onion and a little bit of mayo. You can add salmon or meat, your choice. It comes on their house made english muffins which are huge.(the way an enlish muffin should be) if your hungry this is the sandwhich for you; its filling and delicious. The 2 salads are both vegan and delcious. And surprisingly the salad portion is sufficient. If your not ravneously hungry one or two  of the salads will make you happy. They also have a whole bunch of bakery items and some are vegan and a few are whole grain and healthy. All the food is made at the moment you order it. You can see the chefs moving about in the kitchen doing their  best whipping up some yummy food. They also make delicious pizza, which is also freshly prepared right in front of you. La Grande Orange is a little pricey. But if your particular about what you eat. Like myself and you want to avoid crap fast food. Take the time while your at Skye Harbor and cheque out La Grande Orange. They have got a little bit of some thing for everybody. And its all scruptious and filling.

j3T8m4DSXan8wL1VRm1qQw.text: Love that LGO is at the airport!  Great coffee and pastries.  Perfect for early flights!

TB1vRZv_MJGgiAiqDVJtWg.text: The croissants tasted weird. I should have went back to get my money back but didnt want to miss my flight.

icdqR-Fu3Sp6ueZlTLFPnA.text: Home of my favorite salad ever:  Kale and Quinoa with shredded chicken, grapes, red bell pepper and Champagne vinaigrette.  All fresh and wonderful ingredients, but the one that puts it overt the top is the addition of preserved Meyer lemon.  When I fly west, I choose Phoenix as the layover so that I can get his salad.  That is how good it is.  Just the right mix of fresh, high quality ingredients plus the wonderful preserved Meyer lemon. Fabulous!

ZsJyQp4oIFGJpphbOf9Gfg.text: Not the best experience for me and my wife.  Only reason for 1 star is because 1) we got our food, and 2) a man that seemed to be the manager/owner asked us if we needed help with anything while we waited for our food, showing that he's at least trying to act like he cares.  My wife and I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich, a caesar salad, and 2 small mochas.  The salad was pre-made, fair enough. Later on when I did finally eat it, it didn't taste fresh, and I hope they added lemon or something to the dressing, because it tasted kind of funny. Hopefully my stomach won't be making me pay the price.  Our mochas came out next, and tasted cheap. And...did they use Hershey's chocolate syrup?! $3.50/ea for 12oz cups of cheap mocha, nice.  Grilled cheese with fries took way too long to make. We stood around for a good 20-30 minutes, and was starting to get concerned that we wouldn't have enough time to each before we have to board our flight.  The place is way overpriced. Over $20 for a small thing of lettuce, small grilled cheese with some  fries, and 2 small mochas.  Oh, and the girl that took our order was...having a bit of an attitude. Someone's tired from working hard all day, I assume. Thanks for showing it to your customers!  Overall, would NOT recommend this place at all to anybody.  Pros: -Got our food -Next to our gate  Cons: -Bad food -Bad service -Slow -Overpriced -Possibly expired food

R6NnPKY94wvKr6PNLUdUVQ.text: Love that I can enjoy the awesome food even at the airport, but it is not as tasty as the restaurant in the city

AOw2aqXbwaryMfKCx_44dQ.text: great airport food! affordable & good quality - similar to grande orange on 40th st. also, lots of outlets!

nYfIYuCnQPl8bZNLMgqMMg.text: Well, I tried to get my LGO fix before I left Phoenix. I made the mistake of thinking the airport version was the same as the flagship location in Arcadia. I have been to the flagship store over 100 times, and the food quality is always consistent & excellent. Their pizza is amazing yes, but so is their green chile burger. It's a generous beef patty made with never-frozen grass-fed beef. Now for the airport version of the green-chile burger that doesn't belong in the same universe: the beef patty was not the same weight, it was a thin, dry McDonald's quality patty. It lacked flavor and was just old & tired. Also I asked for it to be cooked medium & it was well-done. I don't think the English muffin was from LGO. There was no Russian dressing. The green chiles were soggy & disgusting to the point I took them off. I didn't have time to bring it back since I had to board a plane. If you are looking for a top-notch restaurant in Phoenix give LGO in Arcadia a try. Skip the airport location which is bringing down their brand that they have been trying to establish for many years.

SeMW2QCYVwvL1idqPDA_1A.text: What a treat to find a delicious and healthy place to eat in an airport. First time eating lunch here .... And it did not disappoint.  The chopped Thai salad is delish!!!!

cUmYXYsUmJUYRj-VX1r2Kg.text: Wow, what a pleasant surprise!  Airport food at its finest.  When at the PHX airport, skip the typical fast food options--this place is a must!  With an emphasis on high-quality, fresh, and interesting, this little hotspot in Terminal D has a global undercurrent.  The food is amazing -- burgers, sandwiches,  salads, pizza, gelato, desserts, and beer/wine.  Funky, euro music, ample seating, and quick service.

90A5a8Jo67Y326oEeb8G7w.text: My flight was delayed again! I gotta get a better job....I actually miss sitting in traffic going to work instead of this flying for business. But we all gotta make a living.  So I had a couple of hours to spare and I figured by the time I get to my destination and hotel everything would be closed and I would end up up putting the feed bag on at the snack machine.  I found this place La Grange Orange. I think there another one in town. So I gave it a whirl. I had the BLT. Great!    Pros The food tasted great and was satisfying.  Staff was courteous and pleasant.  The bill was not expensive compared to most airport eateries.  The atmosphere felt like any eatery out in town. It didn't feel like a airport eatery.   Cons  No cons.   .

wHmeOugu-78eF-yNy5RWcg.text: What do the Fallen Angel, Sea Salt Chocolate Chip Cookie and Chips and Dip appetizer all have in common? They are all amazing and best of breed. I'm glad I don't live close enough to go here every day, or I would. LGO is the best pizza in town and the best bakery in town, hands down.

TQbwmA6nrkTVuQru42G2SA.text: Scrambled eggs like rubber. Cheapest generic bacon money can buy. They can't even toast bread. It was raw. Did I mention it was expensive!? I fell for this twice. Same exact result. I always wonder how its possible to have a business and produce such crappy food!? Wish I could give them zero stars! Go to Paradise.

uwjPiReWWzJR7O2J0t80Xg.text: Just like the 40th street location....the good and the bad.  The process is high maintenance to get good food with fresh ingredients, but how much hassle does a veggie wrap or sundried tomato salad really require?  Not worth it.  The food is good but a pain to acquire.

3y5FkdLm78Yoa9Es_pxl6g.text: My flight got delayed so I decided to stop here and grab something to eat. I ended up getting a turkey sandwich and cheese pizza. Not bad at all.

SA5ttnUj39IoQdbGHE5DoQ.text: Love this place.. Always a great vibe. Food is always the same, yet predictably great. I highly suggest it.. Just remember there is typically a line at lunch so get there early

tSRk5y8CimLEVn_-WoU4tg.text: Seriously disappointed.  I drove past several "real" restaurants to get to the airport early because a Phoenix local said they were excellent. Not sure what I was expecting, but it sure wasn't this. The California burger was just passable.  The counter person emphasized how they cook their patties medium.  Mine was medium well PLUS.  No moisture left in the meat and it was nothing more than an $11 slider.  The sea salt brownie was inedible. The texture was supposed to be fudgy but came off as undercooked.  Tables are basically on the concourse so after settling diwn you have to pick up your things and try to balance it all with your plate of food.  A juggling act for the lone traveler.  The one bright spot was the hand cut well seasoned fries. Brought back memories of pre-franchise Chili's in the 70s or early 80s.  Two stars is probably generous.

SY_cXrsoY-LeDFlGixGUig.text: Any time we need a connecting flight to the West Coast, I'm picking Phoenix. Because this place has the best gluten free pizza I've ever had. They need to patent their recipe and sell it to all the other restaurants that are trying to make GF pizza. DH says his regular pizza was darned good too.  Be warned, the GF pizza takes a while. It is not something you can order and get while your airplane is boarding!

LO9L9Qn89-BV-ZyoiCJyKA.text: 11 bucks for a cheeseburger would almost be acceptable if the cheeseburger were exceptional. The burgers served here are not. It's an airport with few options for food so I suppose they are taking advantage of a captive audience. On the plus side, the service is good and it looked like the folks who ordered the pizza were happy. Next time I'll try that instead.

ck2XDlVsenzXXjwZ_VfcOg.text: A great place to eat when you have time before your flight or to just grab a sandwich (and maybe a cookie) on the go.  We had a layover in Phoenix, so we grabbed some lunch here.  We ordered turkey sandwiches and a sea salt chocolate chip cookie.  The sandwiches were made on a soft high quality bread, a generous stack of sliced turkey breast, and fresh produce.  It was a large sandwich, which kept us full through our following flight.  After the sandwich we shared the cookie, and it was truly the best cookie I ever ate.  It was big and soft, yet it had slightly crispy edges, and was loaded with chocolate chips and sprinkled with sea salt. It had a lovely contrast of sweet and savory, and it was buttery and chocolaty.  This was the first time I had a cookie with sea salt, and I am totally hooked!  If I ever fly through Phoenix again, I will make sure to make at pit stop here!   Also next time I want to try pizzas, as they looked and smelled delicious!

HeAmsNi44pwuvatI5IPsRQ.text: I had the bbq bacon cheeseburger and it was quite tasty.  The cookies are huge and delicious!  Try the A-Z cookie for something unique (variety of nuts, chocolate chips and cornflakes).  The sea salt chocolate chip cookie also looked quite good, and they have a few gluten-free cookies too

liYQcuXCF_2ENRmWnF-eKA.text: Really very good for airport food.  The choices were unique and a bit new age.  I had a breakfast burrito with tofu in it.  It was really very good.  The cashier who helped me was fun and seriously perky.  I was scanning the wall menu and then looked around for a cashier in a dazed 'lost airport soul' manner.  He grabbed my attention with eye contact and handed me a menu then led me to the right counter.  Great customer service!  It was also a nice place to sit and wait for my flight.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute airport restaurant.

mrJIY3nZjKfRd3Yra05WLA.text: Just had the green Chile burger waiting for my flight, and it was *delicious*. Fast and friendly staff too.

3Tc1x5CEpCxUHxGYB-i56g.text: So as you don't miss your next layover, I'll keep it quick and concise:  Fries that come with the burgers are actually pretty good. Burgers are small as heck for $13something, but hey, i t s a i r p o r t f o o d. Price aside, I ordered my BBQ Bacon burger cooked medium, and I think they did a pretty good job getting it right. I have no clue if I'll ever rate an airport restaurant 5 stars, but I think this one is above average. Pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

agrCuxGVbxwAwRH1xIcjgg.text: Oh my gosh! The evening staff is INCREDIBLE!!! So personal and friendly! And went over the top for my custom last minute order! Kudos!

KkNUzPHmPDYv7MOSPrwh6g.text: I had a personal pizza, pepperoni. In terms of my experience with this pizza only, I thought the pics was not tasty at all, compared with little Cesar or cpk. Just salty and oily. The cook cut the pizza apparently doesn't really care that he is in an airport with travelers as the main customer base. The pizzas are cut very carelessly, and some like mine has one cut on the very edge and another one at the other edge not even close to the middle, and if course the cuts barely cut through the cheese and not the dough. For $15 even at an airport it was overpriced.

Qsl9Bcfp33g8xLq5-EJtkw.text: my absolute favorite restaurant!!! i'm in love with their vegan pizza!!! there is no other vegan pizza like it. the desserts, such as the cookies, macarons, and brownies are really cute/good too. though, every time i come in it feels like there is a new method for ordering. the shop section they have is always fun the explore and the staff is very nice.

2yyFIhik7mr7nRS8dhIo7Q.text: The highlight of my visit to PHX terminal 4. Seriously the best baked goodies ever. This place is always packed and for good reason. My 1st time here was a mini personal pizza that will blow away any MOD, Pieology or Blaze. The crust is awesome!

fruUwAiIycWoQUq1DJiMaQ.text: The pizza here is phenomenal. We had the Gladiator. Sausage and sauce are spot on. My wife and I were amazed that we just ate a fantastic pizza in an airport!  Alexis rang us up and she was friendly and polite. Great job Alexis!

INTZ2wU_YpNwmxB2YEwNMg.text: I love the Grande, but why does everything have to be served in Plastic? So many ppl eat in the lounge and don't even take their food to go. It would be nice to have the alternative real fork and plate, if you want it.

6k3jLO8lv-MVDi_1DAKFWQ.text: La Grande Orange has a little bit of everything, giving you quality, freshly prepared dishes quickly and at reasonable prices.    It's compact but there are lots of different food stations. You can order breakfast sandwiches at one cashier, pizza at another, salads, sandwiches, cookies, juices and more. They have a modern menu with healthy choice options like Kale and Quinoa salads, Veggie Burgers, Chickpea Lettuce Wraps, along with all your more "normal" food items.   Commuter Sandwich (Bacon, Scrambled Eggs, Tomato, Mayo, add Avocado on an English Muffin) - I was really impressed with the freshness of my breakfast sandwich. For the main item, I could have had bacon, ham, turkey, smoked salmon or avocado. I went with bacon and they only charged me an extra dollar to add avocado. I would totally order this again.    They have so much stuff to choose from here that everyone in your party should be able to find something to eat for breakfast or lunch. If you are in a hurry, you can pick up food to go quickly here, or you can sit down and eat after you order and pay as it's a fast casual spot. One of the guys working at the airport Starbucks suggested this place to me and I'm glad they did!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Commuter w/ Bacon add Avocado
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5_jTpBoSK2m92iuZDVJq_A.text: @ least pkg isn't a problem...lol! Unfortunately same rude employees, arrogant mgmt & high prices (even @ airport). There are simply too many other better options to choose from...lgNo!!!

pOKqKnqDJwjj9UjGSjWOVQ.text: I come by PHX often and it's nice that Southwest terminal has lots of food options.  Line is always long but service is fast and friendly. I always get great pastries and their honey latte is to die for.   I went in for lunch today, had their tortilla soup which was very fresh and had chunks of chicken and avocado. I also ordered their tuna Nicoise salad which was ok. When it comes to tuna Nicoise I have a very particular idea in my head and this is more Americanized Nicoise salad. The tuna was way too sweet with raisins in it. Big chunks though which was great. Not a big fan but the salad was fresh and the hard boiled egg was perfectly cooked. The dressing was light and just had the right tanginess. Had the tuna been lemon based, it would be perfect.   I'm still a fan and will come by this place whenever I'm in the Terminal D.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna Niçoise salad-- not a fan but salad is fresh
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tortilla soup-- started eating it before I took the pic. Really awesome!

5eXtD-WwpcLhF__VUmPNmg.text: Reasonably priced for the Airport. Fast service , delicious Guacamole BLT, and a great cold brew coffee while waiting for my flight.

W-ZxFXNsj1clomjp6ss6Qg.text: I was in Phoenix for the day on business and landed around breakfast time, feeling a bit famished (the peanuts on my two-hour Sourhwest flight from Oakland were a bit inadequate). A quick glance at my Yelp app while standing in front of the first restaurant I came across - La Grande Orange - happily revealed that the very same establishment came highly recommended! "What luck," I thought to myself.   I ordered a Zuni Burrito off the breakfast options helpfully put up on a board behind the counter, and waited about 10 minutes for my food, eagerly anticipating the tofu "chorizo" and charred tomato salsa (among other things like mushrooms, corn, potatoes, egg whites and spinach) my Zuni was meant to be filled with.   I opened up my burrito and the wrapper came apart. I have never had a burrito be served to me so badly wrapped. Never. Re-wrapping it up myself, I took my first bite, getting huge chunks of potato and bland tofu, but little else. This continued as I worked my way through this sorry excuse for a breakfast burrito, vainly searching for all the ingredients which were promised, letting out small grunts of satisfaction when I found a kernel of corn or a bit of spinach or mushroom. But it was mostly a mass of potato and tofu.   Filling, yes. Tasty, no. So if you decide to breakfast here, do yourself a favor and order something else. Not the Zuni Burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They also serve a few varieties of alcoholic beverages here.
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Several breakfast choices - I had the Zuni burrito.
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plenty of seating, and I liked the cheerful green chairs.

CQghAkK8t_qux5lyXMOLww.text: Well, the food is good but the service at the airport location is atrocious. I waited at one register but the workers were too busy talking about their weekend plans to help me so I went and stood in line at the other register. When it came time for my turn the cashier walked off then a line formed at the first register where I initially waited. After a couple minutes I waved someone down and asked if I could pay here and he said he didn't realize I was ready. People standing at a register with their to-go salad looking inpatient generally mean they're ready. Anyway, I paid and left and the salad was tasty but the customer service is abysmal. Nothing like the Acadia location.

wLMnZzcr_IHF6vXfIGGx8w.text: Lah Grand Orange?  Lah Gran-day Orange?  Lah Grann Or-hange?  I still don't know how to pronounce this place but whatever.  LGO it is.  The point is that I totally didn't expect to find pizza of this caliber at an airport.    Yelp said there was pizza here and that's all I needed to know to make the (loooong) walk from Concourse A to Concourse D.  I figured it would be one of those places where you point to a pre-made slice (sunning under a heat lamp for who knows how long) and wait for them to reheat it in the oven.    Instead there was a guy behind the counter flinging crusts with flour all over his apron.  They did have a display of pre-made pizzas but since they were out of cheese, they made our pizza fresh to order.  It took about ten minutes for it to come out.  It was a thin crust pie...nice and cheesy without being oily.  I got a stack of napkins to blot oil off the top but didn't even need to use them.  There were tiny chunks of tomato in the sauce and the sourdough crust had a satisfying crunch.  The pie was large enough for us to split but only because we were saving room for gelato.   The Mint Chunck (their spelling, not mine) was delicious too.  I was expecting a mint toothpaste flavor but instead it was earthy.  Bits of real mint were mixed in with broken slabs of chocolate (stracciatella style) and it was surprisingly good.  Again...not what I expected in an airport.    My only complaint about LGO was the lack of seating.  They had a cute cafe area out front but every seat was taken...too many of them by people who weren't even eating...reading newspapers, typing away on laptops, watching phone videos.  Fortunately, there were two open seats at one table and the people sitting there invited us to join them.    That aside, it was an enjoyable meal.  We'll be back to LGO on our way back through.  If we can find a place to sit next time, I will bump to five stars.

Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mint Chunck has real bits of mint
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeeesy!

27KUCOhTRZPlQalj2tbo7w.text: [Out-of-Towner Review]  Concourse D...  ...for DAMN, I only have about 20 mins before I need to get on my connecting flight home. Even though the other spot looks good, their to-go section didn't look as great.  So, after perusing La Grande Orange, then coming back to it...I walked away with a Pepperoni Pizza and a water. Of course it's overpriced, but it was pretty tasty. And by tasty I mean so oily it had to be good. For real though, it was tasty, but it literally comes with at least a liter of oil.  They had a bunch of drink options, salads, burgers, and a slew of other options. However, the pizzas are literally there for you to grab, pay, and go. Which is exactly the criteria that is needed when you only have 20 mins before your next flight.  It's decent, I was happy, but damn that box makes it hard to travel with. I'm pretty sure your fellow passengers will be envious of your food, so eat it coyly...as best you can with a pizza box to maneuver.  Grab more napkins than you'd think you'd need for ten pizzas, then grab a few more...

P9dE_6HPJdck70FbQskauA.text: Airport restaurants are usually hit or miss...but this place is a hit for me.  A simple deli style, no server cafe that serves burgers, pizza, salads, sandwiches, breakfast and a variety of desserts. I got myself a California Burger (angus beef, havarti cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions).  My first impression was that it is definitely smaller than the usual burgers served at other restaurants, but I guess that is to be expected in an airport.  With that being said, the burger was actually just the right size, very juicy and full of flavor. It also comes with  hearty side of fries. Airport priced, but well worth it.   The only thing I did not like about this place is that they do not offer fountain drinks...only bottled, and those cost $2.79 each . Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gS4tGNvypqpBUpJD3h4G9Q.text: My FAVORITE place to eat. Need to post pictures later but it's sooo delish, I forget to take a picture. This is my treat every trip, I'm a flight attendant. I love THE COMMUTER sandwich anytime of day. The bacon is so crispy and they are NOT stingy!!!! I also love the CHEESEBURGER- I choose to get it on an English muffin. Mmmmmm. The salads are also exceptional. The TURKEY salad, is amazing! The Kale (add chicken) salad is a flight attendant favorite. It's good but I love the other stuff too much.  IT IS PRICEY, but worth every penny ;) They also have a stamp card, for $10 off after every 10 purchases. Basically a FREE meal if you frequent often

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TURKEY salad sub shredded chicken
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE COMMUTER
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Commuter with Bacon (I order mine no tomatoe)

-NPnQFKgYH-s0YDue2tb5w.text: I used to live across from LGO in Arcadia and went daily (literally).  I am as so excited to land at terminal D to stop!  What a disappointment. We got the cheese pizza.  Although it seemed busy, I'm sure this was sitting out all day (after being overlooked and rock hard on top). $14 for a terrible pizza?!  Any frozen pizza or sabaro beats this any day.  This is NOT LGO.  Overpriced and terrible. Skip it and go anywhere else.

9-zTO8XLMLJfHbwbWDfBUQ.text: It's not secret that I love LGO and the fact that now I can enjoy a commuter breakfast sandwich while waiting for my flight is amazing! This is LGO airport-edition so it lacks the charm that the actual LGO has, but it has much more charm than an airport restaurant should! The food tastes exactly the same, the prices are the same, the service is the same and they are very fast!   I visited for breakfast and enjoyed the commuter sandwich but noticed that they have a wood-fired oven to make their well-known pizzas and they have a full menu of LGO favorites including all their breakfast, lunch and dinner offerings. They also have the cookies, baked goods and pre-made sandwiches.   LGO is located at gate D and it's worth visiting regardless of your location in Terminal Four!

lkbYltw_hElM-RHoz-t9fQ.text: Love the healthy food options at this place, much better than most of the things you can get at an airport.   Food (breakfast) was good, service was quick, coffee was flavorful, and the menu had a good variety. Definitely a great place for someone to go to if they are spending a lot of time in an airport and don't always have access to tasty healthy food.  I ordered the Daybreaker, which it a turkey egg white omelette, but what makes it tasty was the avocado salsa that came with it.  Looking forward to my next trip.

Iq5yjDTRBtj3elzcPmeikA.text: The turkey sandwich was very fresh and excellent as was the tropical tea. I appreciated that the fruit side didn't have melons but apples, grapes and pineapple. The best part was great service from Xavier. As a semi-frequent traveler, his friendliness was wonderful. I'll be back! (The 4 instead of 5 was the pre-formed burger patty on my husbands burger).

-xehPUK4MwXgqyB0H0h56Q.text: La Grande Orange is so great! They have a delicious vegan pizza that can also be made gluten-free, which satisfied my gluten-free and dairy-free diet. Also, their salads are fantastic. I will definitely be back!

p_H29Dqg2be8MLYqYzJ3og.text: My hubby and I were relieved to have a delicious food option while waiting in between flights. Here are my strong recommendations for you to try when ordering:  1) Kale and Quinoa salad 2) Avocado pizza (must try if you like margarita pizzas and avocado- good combination!) 3) Gladiator pizza (red sauce is okay but the meat is good).  A 5/5 experience. Customer service was impressive. Upbeat attitude at the register and when we were finished with our food, we had an attendant who took away our pizza racks right away. Wow! Very happy and satisfied!

VPgoXlLZYyjmDgQzZclfkA.text: Grabbed a quinoa and chopped kale salad.   It's already in a plastic to go container, so you can grab and take if you don't have time.   They do have Siracha hot sauce and Tabasco on the way out if you want to spice it up.   My salad with tax was $10.29.

e8NiX1oQ1uwH589L5i2g5Q.text: I was delightfully surprised to see LGO at the Southwest Terminal at Sky Harbor.    The only thing that was an issue was where to line up to order and pay for your food. The space isn't large and what free space is left over is mostly taken up by displays; add in travelers with carry on luggage and it easily gets crowded.  Everyone seemed to congregate at the middle register. I avoided waiting in line by walking up to the clerk at the far left (empty) register to ask if it was open, which she was. Keep in mind there were 3 registers open, but the clerks at the 2 side registers weren't proactively assisting in clearing out the group of waiting customers nor were fellow customers aware that there were 2 other open registers *sigh*  Anyway after a weekend of non-stop weekend I wanted something healthy. I ordered the Zuni burrito: whole wheat tortilla with tofu chorizo; corn; spinach; potato; egg whites; and charred tomato salsa. YUM!  My favorite of all the ingredients was the charred tomato salsa. If they packaged and sold this in a bottle, I'd buy it!

TiBO0yUxa8cAloo7GVJ_tg.text: It is so nice being able to have GOOD food at the airport instead of standard fast food junk. I've enjoyed dinner on the go from LGO the last two times I've flown. I love that the salads are quick and ready to go. The smoked salmon salad is delicious and filling. It doesn't look like a lot when you first open the container but it's bigger than you think.  Their pizza is also very good but head's up - it's not premade so it takes about 15 minutes. Make sure you have enough time to wait. Their bakery items are also really yummy.  The set-up seems a little confusing for people but the staff is friendly. This place definitely makes airport food not only bearable but actually enjoyable.

PdkWYmWrqTVFnG4tFI3tEw.text: ate here thursday, chopped turkey salad was bomb.  big, fresh and good.  nice dressing   great service and quick.  tables are clean with charger plug.  nice prices are good and they have everything you would want - sandwiches, pizza, burgers, soups, salads, wraps, baked stuff  only thing bad here are the cookies - the cookies look amazing but taste like crap - dry, crumbly, too salty, just not good - and I am a fat guy who loves his cookies - i seriously bought every flavor of the big cookies at $2.75 each - they all sucked, took a bite of each and threw them all in the trash  bummer all else good though

JDyvt4_sv2gcER3_Z2EBmg.text: Pizza's are made fresh and they will make you forget that you are in an airport!  Sea Salt Chcolate Chip Cookie is HUGE for the price and you must come here if you want a cheap bottle of water.  Everything is very affordable, especially for airport food!

j6Nw7r8flIvgexh9Bymo0g.text: Quick airport food really can't get any better.  Everything is top notch here. Great burger!

Aq20f3Tz8ukS35tSoC2bGg.text: Ordered the burger.  Very tasty with a soft and light sesame bun.  Fresh shaved cheddar is served on the side, along with lettuce, tomato, red onion, and dill pickle slices. Fries are shoestring size with skin on and served in a paper bag.  Expensive (but tasty!) airport burger - $14.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious!

hlHr1LiGKq0ZfQPedpbtEw.text: I stopped by here to grab a quick lunch on a short layover after a 4 hour flight.  After doing a quick search on where to eat inside the secure areas at PHX, I walked by to see the place was poppin with activity, and I could see people at the tables enjoying some good looking sandwiches.  What drew me in though was the alluring case pastries!  This is one of those times I wish could just pack boxes of food into my carry on luggage.  They also make pizza!!  Anyway, I got myself the Cubano sandwich...delicious!  It had a good balance of ham, pickle, cheese and the right level of toast on the bread.  Service was pretty quick considering how busy the place was especially on a prime travel day (Friday afternoon, was 5th in line to order, I was in and out in maybe 5-6 minutes...Pro tip: they have multiple registers open, look around and don't get stuck in the longer line).  Prices were about on par with other airports.  I also got a cookie for the gf picking me up at my destination.  Ate some of that, and now I wish I had gotten one for myself!

4mufmG13oTDu0O82_arGDQ.text: I'm always a fan of LGO and what they put out so I was super happy to see the one opened in Sky Harbor. It was breakfast, but I wanted a sandwich. i got the stacked turkey sandwich that came with avocado and bacon, and it did not disappoint. the sandwich was stacked super high with quality ingredients, I was a happy camper. It was to be expected though, since I'm a super fan of LGO's pizza and other goods at their regular locations. Awesome!

pwO1i15-7ba49BnuVHVFLA.text: I am a HUGE fan of the recent T4 restaurant overhaul, and LGO is one of my favorite additions.  I grabbed dinner here before a flight last week and decided on the chickpea lettuce wraps.  My meal cost around $8 and came with two healthy and fresh wraps filled with a chickpea salad, sundried tomatoes, cucumbers and avocado slices.  Other menu options include creative salads (like the shredded kale and quinoa), fresh fruit and healthy sandwiches.    Service was both expeditious and friendly, which was a nice change from the typical surly attitude you get at airport establishments.  In my mind, this is "as good as it gets" at the airport - 5 stars!

XmoDe_uTl1JKVTNMiQtOJw.text: It's often hard to find healthy choices for dinner in airports around the country but I found this place and had an outstanding shredded kale and quinoa salad.  At first glance in the glass displays, I wasn't positive how I felt about ordering a pre-made salad. Usually pre-made means it's been sitting there getting soggy for three days- but no way! It was fresh, delicious, and filling.

_MeJOI6ep-0paxuVZDbmmw.text: Not in the least bit impressed. Dozens of employees moving at a snail's pace behind the counter but nary a customer being helped or served. Had trouble making eye contact, get greeted of have one of the staff take my order even thought I was standing right in front of the register under the order sign. Employees seemed more interested in talking amongst themselves. The apparent manager was complaining to another employee about a previous customer. Decorum & professionalism, please! That's just bad form. Waited 5 minutes for the blandest, crappiest & most expensive egg sandwich I've ever had. I guess when you have a captive market, brand standards, customer service and quality don't matter. Bad move LGO PHX Sky Harbor.

ZQXLhmyPbhqew08UZ_r-5Q.text: Taking airport food to a higher level Granted they get almost $8 for a pair of eggs but youll also get chicken sausage, a fruit cup and and some funky toast. The free fudge while you wait isn't bad either

MJRtJjFAr4KVoISo3AcSoA.text: Healthy food, lots of electric receptacles for charging your e-devices, and two tables that seat eight easily, as well as multiple two-tops. The tuna melt is super delicious with just a few partially dried grapes to give it a burst of flavor. The whole wheat bread is baked fresh by La Grande Orange. I also enjoyed an oatmeal cookie.

mkQrhKjM-9sXkoxDZyLcOA.text: Nice service.  Has all the LGO faves.  Definitely a new fave for when I travel and thank goodness it's located in the SWA terminal!

46Wsp3d1OC_aQGBeU93xkQ.text: Five star every time! Every time!!!! The pizzas are fantastic. We ordered the margarita and pepperoni pizzas and they arrived so hot I had to blow on it before taking a bite, how often does that happen when you out out? Insane, the favors were insane!!!

rqACMVFMQNxnnUcIQsmdyg.text: Is the pineapple supposed to be hard and the orange juice taste a little spoiled? Other reviews seem to agree. I should have double checked this place before spending over $10 on breakfast.

wPSQj0Xi5MBNRr-EPtZMWQ.text: I agree this is a fairly amazing option for an airport, the veggie sandwich was above average, the ingredients were fresh and it comes with a healthy pineapple slice as a side.  I also agree the ordering/pickup setup is a challenge.  There are two places to pickup your order depending on what you ordered which gets confusing when you order multiple items that need to be picked up from both stations, but overall it was great to have this place as an option during an airport layover.

uRi7CezVKvQXFADsJt7oHQ.text: Eew!!! A salad with shredded iceberg lettuce and a few measly specks of bell pepper topped with disgustingly shredded chicken. Dressing was way too oily. The whole experience was less than mediocre. Fortunately I'm not in Phoenix too often in the D Terminal. Will eat somewhere else next time!!

jNZjW4PXH3l3l7gjLy-NOw.text: The last few times I have eaten here the food has been awesome and the staff super nice. Looks like management has brought up the politeness & professionalism since my last review here. I would definitely recommend this spot now.   The only down side is that the food takes a bit of time to get after you order at the register (about 15-20min). So if you are rushed for a flight, you might want to grab something pre-made here instead of a sandwich or something they have to prepare.

24VYQvLPxG5dEtBCx3lLEA.text: O B S E S S E D  Terminal D. Go out of your way to eat here when you are in the airport.  My personal favorite:  kale and quinoa salad.  It is adorned with parmesean cheese, grapes, sunflower seeds and lemon zest.  The dressing perfectly compliments this grouping and always leaves me satisfied! The fruit tarts are amazing- no jellies, just fruit and an amazing pastry crust!  And something I NEVER would have tried, but they sampled one day:  the gluten free walnut, chocolate chip cookie!  It is almost gooey in the center with a brownie-like taste.  It is just amazing! The pizzas are also fantastic and the veggie burger goes a long way when I have a few extra minutes to wait for them to make me something or I'm feeling like veggin' out. All I know is that I don't miss getting something from here when I am in this airport and you will thank me for this!

cXArzuXky4W5pnR9HMowEQ.text: Loved my bbq bacon burger and draft Stella beer.  Came on a fresh brioche bun and the bacon was soft and tasty.  Fries were crisp, salty and fresh. Couldn't have been better!!

THQ93xiRt9F6VVYyHb1fFA.text: I visited the little LGO at the Phoenix Airport and loved it! Great service, good food, and delightful hot cocoa. So thankful for this spot of heaven before getting on a plane.

mpStYsWaSrFtTHGFlrEf5Q.text: Ok, so on my way to Hawaii a couple weeks ago, the BF and I stopped at LGO to get breakfast before our flight....now, this was a big commitment because it is on the complete opposite side of the airport as where our gate was so it then required us to make a lap around terminal 4 (which is pretty huge). Anyway, I got the commuter sandwich after all of the hubbub about how awesome it was from everyone....it was not good! The eggs appeared to be the same microwaved eggs you get at Einstein's and the sandwich had little to no flavor....The bacon was sad and flaccid. Luckily, I also got a red velvet cupcake again which allowed this  establishment to remain a 4 star place just for the sheer glory of that cupcake, but come on people! There needs to be some quality control or something, because that sandwich was just sad.

kuZvD1KR6xR-W2-MUcy3KQ.text: Pizza is crisp and tasty, at least the gladiator pizza. Staff is super friendly.  Ordered the chicken wings, really good.  But for me the best food to order at this restaurant is the grilled artichokes with aioli sauce.  This meal is a get your hand dirty and dive in kind of meal.  Just delicious.

uYQ-aidAzWrTQCbhVCL0vA.text: The food was okay, but the portion size was way off for the price. It was a small hamburger and it was $12 and I mean a small hamburger. Don't get the burgers there. You'd be better off with one of their sandwiches. I suspect it will be prepared faster than the burger which took 10 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $12 bbq burger was TINY. Decent enough, but it takes about 10 minutes to prepare and the fries were so so...

hvcWVxNyykY_gYL7xi-xKA.text: Best airport food I've seen. Great vegetarian options, vegan bars, gluten free! Thank you for offering some healthy clean vegan/vegetarian options! Rare in airport!! Chef there is fantastic & the staff was great.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best veggie burger I&#39;ve ever had &amp; in an airport, what a treat! Homemade, chef here is fantastic &amp; staff was great!

0pPflQKkHQncqZ1Joc4S0A.text: I would love this place alot more if i could ever figure out where to order or where to pick up my food.  Super disorganize layout.  The food is average for the aiport, but decent coffee.  Its definitely a better than the  taco joint next door.  However, your best bet at sky harbor is to eat on the main concourse in terminal 4.  Once you get past security the selection of food drastically narrows.

Dw_nfG49yb3BTVmSzi9I9Q.text: Cubano hot sandwich is really good!!  Ham, pickles & Cheese.  FAST & FRIENDLY STAFF......just what you need when you're in a rush to catch a flight .

Og6ljGZOJzrXD-DfQPflZw.text: Especially for airport options, thank god for LGO at Sky Harbor! The delicious margherita pizza was a tad heavy on the mozz, but better to have too much than too little! The pizzeria chop is lovely as well, with a nice balance of healthy veggies and savory (not so healthy) elements. (Hubby and I shared everything and def feel satiated.) Service is quick and informative. As far as airport food goes, this exceeds expectations. Who wants fast food crap when you can wait 10 min for relish real food?   Oh...and $5 glasses of house wine are also a bargain at PHX!

htQL09SCKbwZIkxs5gQ5xQ.text: Good pizza. I had the margarita pizza and really enjoyed it.  My wife had the cheese pizza. For her that bottom was a little burnt. This is a problem with these stone baked pizzas from time to time.   The setup of this place in the airport had its high points and low points. Trying to get in a get food from the 3 different areas (burgers, bakery, pizza) in the place was odd even when there were few people. The tables were nice though. There are tables that have plug-ins for your devices.   I would certainly go here again if I am in the Phoenix Airport.

E1oUBj84BQGboTywV23djw.text: I was impressed by the amount of of choices ! There are a lot of sandwiches (hot and cold), burgers, soups salads, pizza and other things.   I ordered a cheeseburger with pickles and fries. It took about 10 minutes to make, which really wasn't too bad. The burger was $13, so a little pricey but what else do you expect from an airport... However, it was tasty. The meat was extremely juicy, but the bottom bun was soggy mid way through. French fries were ok, not my favorite. Their ranch was not the business. My coworker got the margarita pizza and said it was really good.  The soups an salads looked good.   The person working the cash register was a sweetie and very attentive to all of the customers. :)

lPjgotILoeY2Sep7qJlLeg.text: Kale and quinoa  salad at the airport???? Yes please!  The helpful Southwest agent recommended that I run down to Terminal D to grab a healthy lunch. Apparently I don't strike people as the Pizza Hut personal pan pizza type. I digress.  The helpful staff patiently answered my OCD ingredient questions. My kale and quinoa salad was made with fresh sheeps cheese, sunflower seeds, red pepper, grapes and a lemon-pepper vinaigrette.  SO GOOD!  The vegetarian sandwich with harvati and goat cheese also looked delicious, as did a number of other menu items. I will DEFINITELY be back the next time I'm flying through Phoenix!   Ready to sit through my three hour flight with my belly satisfied rather than about to throw up from a greasy food overload. I arrived at my destination feeling healthy and light!  Oh, and it's worth the walk down to terminal D  for sure!

fgRdZp7ECcV9O2R77RyOag.text: Quick + Fresh + Vegan (super cheap) options!  Had spicy chickpea wrap + kale salad for $16 at the AIRPORT!   Would love to see this at LAX!!

G2KKl-mddZDS1jWaGyTwUQ.text: Good food ordered the flame broiled cheese burger with fries and the guacamole BLT. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oyrSxwCTLMl5qCklI-O3Hg.text: I still haven't been to the "regular" LGO location in Phoenix, but I liked the one in the airport.  In general, terminal 4 at Sky Harbor has developed some good restaurants, but this might be the best one once you get past security. I like that there's several options including salads, pizza, sandwiches, and even breakfast.   I had a chopped salad and really liked everything in it. It's always a little annoying to have to mix dressing (which the vinegarette here is really good!) in those plastic containers w/the salad contents, but what are you gonna do when you grab and go at the airport? I saw a woman behind the counter putting salads together so it looks like they put fresh ones out pretty often. I also snuck a piece of cheese pizza from my mom and it tasted good.   They have a couple beers on tap & a few wines to choose from. The food here seems pretty comparable in price to the regular restaurant, but alcohol is a little more (as the airport does).   I also tried the cookie with "everything" in it (forget what it's called) and it was yummy!

1wcqFB_CdY44JhL09WXrEw.text: Usually, Southwest Airlines' gates have boring food, especially if you have an early morning flight. I was delighted to see that good ol' La Grande Orange has a huge restaurant/shop here. It's not a sit down restaurant so you can just purchase your stuff, wait to be called, and then find a random table.   It was early, so I only ordered a pastry and chocolate gelato. The morning bun $3.30 was warmed upon my request and it was sugary and good. The flavor of the chocolate gelato $3.50 was good, but there were too many ice chucks. They seem to have a good variety of breakfast, lunch, and dinner options.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morning bun
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Menu

hRJmRyTxKPCXj5VZSgBl-g.text: Ordered the vegetarian sandwich with bell peppers, tomatoes, guacamole, greens, on some type of wheat bread - flew from Phoenix to Oakland a couple hours later, and when I arrived in Oakland, holy-moly-guacamole-diarrhea here we come! Yee ha! Be careful people! Dirty places = dirty food = bacteria = diarrhea!

_xHy03-GCKAphdLGtwWCmA.text: Pricey, but good!  I had the Cuban sandwich, which wasn't made with the typical bread but it was still a decent sandwich.  They have pizzas and salads and wraps along with other selections and serve breakfast too.

JXex5vz0uADCtk0iiXb2Xw.text: There is A LOT to love about this place from the market to the pizzeria! I love the coffee bar and am pretty much addicted to the iced coffee! It's strong but smooth. I love all of the cute things to look at in the market and they have a great selection of sodas, tea, wine and beer. The gelato is amazing!!! My favorite flavors are coconut and pistachio. Now for the pizzeria, all of the pizza is good! The sourdough crust is what make the pizza in my opinion. My favorites are the rocket man (spicy) and I add chicken sausage, the fallen angel no fennel add broccoli or just classic pepperoni add Fresno chili (spicy) and an egg! The pimento cheese dip is phenomenal and I could eat wayyy too much of it. Salads: pizzeria chopped or smoked salmon, both delicious! And try the wings! Extra crispy extra sauce on the side with house made ranch!

Ja5EaIrSl3bt7SKtJnE5UQ.text: Wow!  This was really good food.  No not just really good food for an airport.  But really good food for a restaurant.        Quantities are huge especially for what I got.  The vegan spicy chickpea lettuce wraps.  Massive scoops of spicy chickpeas on half a lettuce wedge with fresh avocado and sun dried tomatoes.  My wife enjoyed her tuna melt.  My daughter had a kid grilled cheese with some french fries that were really crispy and delicious.  She topped it off with some chocolate ice cream.       Great place to grab a bite at the Phoenix Airport.  Lots of options.  Sandwiches, breakfast, salads, pizzas, ice cream and snacks.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese and fries
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna melt
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan spicy chickpea wraps

2jytNzMN5wY-GTtSlT0zVA.text: Whaaaatttt?!? I was confused, I was in an airport and I was eating genuinely fresh and delicious and not greasy food... We were on a rushed layover and grabbed a ready made pizza and a boxed salad with low expectations - and were blown away by the freshness, quality ingredients and most of all the delicious, chewy, slow fermented pizza crust. I would actually opt to come here as a restaurant for that - and having it delivered as a pick-up option during a layover it is an EASY 5 stars.  I hate airport food. I loved this. I'll definitely make a beeline back here next time I'm connecting through Skyharbor

dnCPDttTTSg4J3EExezbUA.text: I have always like this place when I'm in PHX airport. I always buy their Kale Quinoa salad. It taste good. They have good customer service too. At least every person who helped me here are nice. They have variety of pastries and they all look good too. I haven't really tried all the entree in their menu, but they all look yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced water

-rc5aEEmWQPA3Vcs_q6mvg.text: This place sucks! They only offer overpriced pre made crap after like 6 pm? Why have a menu when you can't get anything on it. Attitude of counter help was like anything but helpful. Great place for a $14 day old turkey sandwhich. Stay away. Go to c concourse, which is like a mile away for better options.

STdgnnPNcIYjv7Ri_jETDQ.text: Ordered the Daybreaker- egg white omelet with roasted turkey (deli meat) and served with a side of mild salsa, diced avocado and halved cherry tomatoes. You dress the omelet yourself. $10 and a drip coffee $2.50 for a regular size- love that they allow you to refill your coffee; great when your flight is delayed, as mine happens to be!  Nothing over-the-top in flavor here, but it's a nice healthy option at the airport!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Day breaker egg white omelet with avocado-tomato side and salsa $10

6Cxd4Vsn3o7eXPqS9UhPcA.text: I couldn't believe how good this was! I'm giving the rare five stars to an airport grab-and-go for quality and value. I had two scrambled eggs, two slices of sourdough toast, a little fruit and a small drip coffee for $9.50. The eggs were surprisingly delicious - not your standard, rubbery, cheap restaurant eggs. The toast was also wonderful, and came with seedless blackberry jam and two pats of butter. I would have liked more fruit, but the slice of cantaloupe I did have was great.   I would have paid more for this, but I'm glad I didn't have to. They told me it would take ten minutes to prep, which would have been totally fine, but it was more like five. Plenty of seating and a well-stocked extras bar nearby helped me get my coffee ready. This is exactly what you need when you come to the airport, it was the perfect fuel for my travel day!

YXJggQaKloYfu3nlniK9og.text: 3 to 3-1/2 stars. Decent food (we split the fallen angel pizza and green chili burger). Fries were on point. Pizza was nice and cheesy with a crisp bottom crust. Service was reasonably prompt.

eY-TZ5-FFMS5tZYxmg0oPg.text: I love Terminal 4 at Sky Harbor. I fly out of here pretty regularly, and I'm always amazed at the variety of legitimately good local restaurant options here, as opposed to other airports where you're limited to fast food chains.   I'm a huge fan of LGO. Their sourdough English muffins are what dreams are made of; I highly recommend getting your burger on one of those bad boys. Life changing.  I had a 5:55 am flight out of PHX this morning, and luckily for me this location opens at 5 am sharp. I had the commuter sandwich with turkey and avocado ($9.55 + 0.50 to add avocado) and it definitely hit the spot. I ordered at the counter and it was out in less than 5 minutes. For those of you who love spice, they have a condiment bar with Sriracha and Tapatio and a variety of other hot sauces. The large cold brew ($5) is about 20 ounces of smoooooth strong (in a good way!) deliciousness. They have a ton of "patio" tables as well as a couple big communal tables with power sockets if you plan to hang out for a while. If you get a regular coffee - free refills. I didn't have any of their pastries today, but their cupcakes are amazing too :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HkLe43sq2cjBZKb45Va5bw.text: Sausage pizza with Fresno Chili's was spectacular.  Amazing in fact, for an airport.  They have a combo oven and so I asked the cutie pie maker (clever huh?) to char it up a bit by the fire.   Well executed.  And the young African American girl working the floor is a prize employee.  Very helpful and attentive.

g97gmHMbALsY35cwqLaBqA.text: I don't typically write reviews for airport eateries but this place is Good! I was really hungry after a disastrous eating experience in ABQ so I headed straight for La Grande Orange when I got off my Southwest flight.  I ordered pizza and was really surprised how great their crust and toppings are! The Mother Earth has olives, artichokes, roasted peppers, broccolini, mushrooms, tomatoes, fennel, onion, and cheese AND IT'S DELICIOUS! It's made to order so expect to wait about 7-10 minutes but it's so worth it and some of the best pizza I've had (airport or otherwise).

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mother Earth

k9beqXrEjcj57LdEUyFkGQ.text: Quick layover in AZ. I grabbed a scrambled eggs, toast, bacon meal and my daughter had the turkey avocado sandwich. Both were delicious. Ordering and receiving was a little confusing. There were lines of people waiting to pickup their food and people would walk up to order their food and stand behind them. Cashier was available. This could be fixed I think. Food was great and so was the service. If I'm ever hungry and in the AZ airport I will stop here again:)

tsQJlXjm33I-bHq4jY6AFA.text: Great service and great food! Shocked at how awesome it was considering it's an airport bar. Karen is an amazing bartender.

LtNZwdOYNhROX-nnKVUuig.text: Really disappointing breakfast sandwich. Who doesn't toast an English muffin? Soggy bacon isn't  crispy at all.  Just all around disappojnt for $11.

Y3SUA-BqctkhH5pkbrS6Og.text: Flying out of PHX after visiting family for the Holiday. Had to try the veggie sandwich and it didn't disappoint. They had a nice selection of vegan and other healthy options for those that want it.

W4ppzC58hIceFJfTvZQHAA.text: The service was good and fast even when it was crowded. the vegetarian sandwiche is awesome

RGwXCDGKovU-a9wICF57tQ.text: I could have just gotten lucky, but I just seriously got the best damn burger and best fries I've ever eaten at an airport. What a pleasant surprise

JCKk2wnxUPVTABxCLGO2SQ.text: Absolutely the BEST tuna salad in the Salad Nicoise that I have EVER tasted!!  And possibly the best airplane meal I have ever experienced.  This is no tuna from a can - its in nice big pieces with just the right amount of creaminess.  I loved the added golden raisins and the dressing.  The salad comes with kalamata olives, par-boiled green beans, tomatoes, half a (perfectly cooked) hard-boiled egg and a side of green leaf lettuce.  This salad along with a glass of red wine ordered on the flight and I was in heaven!  Great for taking on the plane too - its so fresh, no one will know you are eating tuna and its not at all messy.  Highly recommend!!

MSmDL6tgliUdJXQou6xhyw.text: I had the best cookie ever. Peanut Butter Butterscotch! OMG. I wish I could order them online!

j0A3IssN3GIAzXhcJuO8IA.text: Great vegetarian sandwich!  Staff was courteous, timely, and the food was reasonably priced.  For a quick bite between flights, this restaurant was quite good.

vdfKATLrZPV-eXFYmVzqQA.text: Shockingly delicious airport food - made me happy I was delayed and came over to the D terminal looking for something decent. Had a mushroom and fennel pizza that I wish I'd had time to get again on my way home. The eating area is a nice little oasis in the mess that is PHX.

VRjG-Ko9vAURR01e2boBzw.text: Well I just keep loving LGO! I blame the baked goods that always seem to entice me when I go. Just when I think I'm done placing an order, I look over in the display at the pastries that seem to call out to me and say "Dani, look at me! Eat me! I'm yummy!" I'm making my way through their menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Well I'm not counting the time where I found that they stopped serving chilaquiles, I'm meaning taste wise.

9NIvR45iak27mJL6mteDnA.text: Excited to have this local gem in the airport. No secret it has some ah-mazing food/beverages. Only issue is it's not so easy to see where the line forms to order and it bottle necks and results in several "are you next" questions to be asked to all the other patrons standing around you. Hope they can work on signage to streamline the issue. Glad to see LGO in the airport where it will gain stong visibility.

6vInQ8ez_M7GuTNSPrL5nQ.text: I was very surprised to find good quality and/or healthy choices at an airport. They offer a wide variety of foods from sandwiches to burgers to pizza. I had the Stacked Turkey Sandwich and I was shocked it was very good and it came with a lot of meat. Included with the sandwich were pickles and fruit. The prices are very reasonable, especially for an airport location. One gripe I have with the place is the order pickup. I can't entirely blame the workers because there are just so many people, both patient and impatient, ordering food. The workers are completely lost on orders and can't keep up calling the order numbers. If you can look past the questionable pickup, I definitely recommend this place if you have time and need food at the PHX airport (located at Terminal 4).

BFay1K4QpOjUbIciSsjaFg.text: Great quality as far as airport food goes. They have some menus up, but I had to wander around to find a print menu with their sandwiches. Cubano sandwich was a pretty small portion but was quite tasty. Fruit cocktail was just okay. I'll visit again to try their pizza.

HR3eQnSrvo36_z4J8j4XuA.text: Yes this place is expensive, but if you frequent airports and you want something that tastes good and isn't greasy you will like La Grande Orange. I randomly tried this place a few months ago and I was pleasantly surprised that my English muffin breakfast sandwich wasn't greasy at all. The fresh squeezed orange juice is some of the best that I have had anywhere. I wish there was a place like La Grande Orange in every terminal of every airport. This one is located in Terminal D, I have on multiple occasions made the trip from Terminal C to D and back just to get breakfast here. If there was a way to order online while I was in line for security that would make it even better.

2U3-m4Xr1s2BP7Mv-nFG1w.text: I just love that there is an LGO in the airport now. I always get the day breaker omelet. Delicious every time! And even though this place is always slammed busy they push the food out pretty quick. Good coffee too.  Bathroom is right next door in case you need to make a pit stop before the flight. Last note, the larger tables have outlets in one or two of the corners so you can charge up while you eat.

gImpeXiGZWjSKfmyMZYU5A.text: Excellent burger. The California.  The fries are delicious.  The staff and cashiers were really friendly too.

1rOy57mDO0MdCaeXZ61KJQ.text: I'M SO HAPPY!!! To have La Grande Orange in terminal 4! I had a wonderful green chile cheese burger and craft beer. The boys had lovely pizzas. Makes those pre-flight jitters so much easier to handle. Looking forward to breakfast in the future.

TQs1lCrt7fjevhSyq34m1A.text: A quickie version of one of my favorite restaurants. Smoked salmon salad is still the way to go if you have the discipline of avoiding their carb-loaded goodies: pizza, pastries, gelato, etc. etc.  I hung around for some beers before a delayed flight. I'd avoid the red wine though; it was corky and pretty terrible. Small disappointment in an otherwise great airport option.

Hhb0Th2H-j8xPnc_YD1P7g.text: Grabbed a quick salad while waiting for a connecting flight.  Prices are what you'd expect in an airport, but quality was pretty good.  I had some kind of a pizza salad - complete with olives, pepperoni and a light dressing.  Hit the spot.

ttJREQghQd4d_14gjGdB0w.text: I really wasn't that impressed. I had a Turkey sandwich and they really don't have a great option of breads. I was forced to eat here waiting for a connecting flight because it seemed like the only decent place around. I'd be interested in their breakfast.  Very Average meal that of course because it's in a restaurant I paid a price for. i'd give it another try, they would really have to impress me to get any more stars.

HV4ONC-yUT0O3aBTq66fVw.text: I loooove LGO grocery, and I go there every single time I visit Phoenix. However, the food at this airport LGO just doesn't taste the same. The english muffin for the Commuter Sandwich was stale, and the mayo in it was different. Normally, the mayo sauce is very tasty and is dripping when you eat the sandwich. The Sea Salt Chocolate Chip cookie was definitely not fresh because it was dry and crumbly.    I definitely support LGO, but if you had a choice, go to the real LGO grocery and not the airport one.

D8MOS7PU5zjGfrgUDFmLeQ.text: Really enjoyed the gladiator pizza.  Not a big fan of the salted chocolate chip cookie--maybe an acquired taste.  Would go back for other desserts.

yZ2jerE6iEihuTrS0VMQuQ.text: I am so happy LGO is at Sky Harbor. I travel a lot and I look forward to hitting up terminal D for my LGO fix. The food is the same as the original location, without the lines of course. It's so nice to see some of the best restaurants in phoenix, at sky harbor.

dE4sCRcT-iet8tpepR7Lsg.text: I ate here for lunch. Very disappointed. Ordered caesar salad which was lacking in lettuce and cheese and for the price not worth it. Easier make it better or cheaper. Would not eat here again.

f_XxcV06H_ljV7zw0oh-fw.text: The only thing I can think of while I was eating my soup was what was I thinking. I should've just save my appetite till I came home.  I would have been starving, but I rather be starving than had eaten that disgusting soup.  I could have saved my five dollars for this disgusting, salty, chicken vegetable soup.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Five dollars for this salty, disgusting chicken vegetable soup.

q2mTkOs9V-Y6sZMSwYv5kQ.text: Airport food can be so hit or miss.  This place was a hit!  I went with the green chile burger.  When I received the burger, it seemed a little small.  But at the end of the meal it was the perfect size.  The chipotle aioli was delicious.  I even got an extra side to dip my fries.  If you get stuck in the PHX airport, this place will solve your hunger.

--SQo8kEuc0yP4M5zDjnvQ.text: I want to thank the LGO management team for stepping up to correct the situation and making sure that things were taken care of in the kitchen at LGO PHX.  I'll stop by again during my next trip to PHX.  It's rare to see management actually read and respond to Yelp review - way to go LGO!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mutilated pickles under my 9 grain sandwich to make it nice and soggy!!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gross lettuce

z3eW6mllol6YgrMf4AoJOw.text: $14.25 Pepporoni Pizza was not made to order (kept warm by a heat lamp). High hopes for this place as it is one of the best yelp reviewed but was super disappointed when cashier went and grabbed it off the heat lamp table. Pizza would have been fabulous if it was fresh.  The layout, seating and cleanliness of the place was amazing though

so3DTDqe0Dl011YEAwxlwQ.text: Pizza was pretty good, but on the plane my wife and I both had stomach pains despite ordering different pizzas.

EPIxhmeR0kp31sN9z1ZdYA.text: I love this place, and I love introducing it to friends! The pizza is amazing!!! So good, you have to try the margarita pizza, loaded with fresh basil, they aren't stingy  Great atmosphere, and the bakery....yum.

fXYZx-Bq6CL0imxb1OTutw.text: I did not know there was a La Grande Orange location in the airport until last week! I had never been there before, but always wanted to try. I love that there is so much variety, so many healthy options, and so many vegetarian options! The pizza sounded pretty great, I'll have to try it sometime, but I wasn't super hungry so I went for a salad. I got the Kale Quinoa Salad without cheese, and it was very good. Sometimes kale has an odd taste, or the taste is just overpowering, but I really enjoyed it in this salad. It also came with a lemon vinegarette which was also good. My sister and mom split a burger and chicken ceasar salad, and they both really enjoyed their food as well. Their only complaint was that they did not like one of the dressings, luckily they had it on the side. For dessert we tried an array of cookies! The chocolate chip sea salt was good, but there was too much salt on them. The butterscotch oat cookies were probably my favorite, I love butterscotch. We also tried the A to Z cookie, which was okay, and the peanut butter cookie, which was much better than we had expected it to be! Next time I'm hungry and in terminal D, I will be making a return. Also hope to check out the original La Grande Orange location in the near future!

xLYFfKardRaP3FTRTCBnqQ.text: Back in the day when I was a Montreal Expos Fan, Le Grande Orange was the nickname for the red haired Rusty Staub. The Sky Harbor Airport version is more feminine (La instead of Le) and a pleasent surprise for captive eating between flights. I had the Breakfast Burrito which was really tasty and with a nice kick, despite its overall messiness. Best of all, it filled me up and lasted all the way to a late dinner tonight in Baton Rouge.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kxc1DIKdV2BIpDqaUv5Qew.text: Passing thru on my way to L.A. And I JD to have some coffee. I went for the Carmel latte and it is delicious. Don't hesitate when stopping in Phoenix, Arizona Airport.

Lu-PzhGofn49sP45Q8X0hQ.text: LGO at the airport? Yes please!  I'd heard that LGO had an airport location, but due to the fact that I typically fly US Airways, I never had an opportunity to visit... that is - until yesterday!  I flew Southwest back from New Orleans and to my pleasant surprise, LGO was located right next to the gate that I exited from.  I was so excited to see it, and so impressed with the appearance, that I ended up grabbing a bite and sitting down to eat and do some work rather than rushing home like I usually do!  They did a great job duplicating LGO in it's airport location.  The menu surprisingly offers *almost* everything that the original location at 40th Street and Campbell offers.  (I believe they are just missing the sushi.)  The airport has an LGO Bakeshop... don't miss the butterscotch oatmeal and chocolate chip with sea salt cookies!  And they have a Grateful Spoon gelato area too...  friendly service to boot!  After eating my way through Nola, I passed on dessert this time around, but I went for the Thai Chicken Salad and it tasted just as great as it usually does; I guess they didn't compromise on quality at all!  Now that I know this location exists, I may have to head to the airport a little earlier from now on... cheers to great local options at PHX for travelers!

4Eb5Zc9vWMJ3KpU4idTMZQ.text: One of my favorite places ever! Ive only ever really ordered the pizza and it's amazing!! One of the best vegan cheeses on a pizza you can find around town. Most places use the same old vegan cheese brands but LGO actually makes their own cashew cheese!

Oks6v-7GRZ3YOr2fkuqcRA.text: One of the best places in PHX. Its that good. Also, to whoever your buyer is that makes the call on the products you sell in the grocer--props to them. Love everything.

rJbR30NfK5EiLu0lqucTIA.text: What in the world. Eating here makes you forget you are at the airport. If you are a foodie looking for a decent spot for a salad, pizza, burger, or pastry I would highly recommend this place.   They are working on the confusion that other reviewers noted about where to order and where to pick up. The cashier specified where I should wait for my items.   TIP: The Thai chicken salad is amazingly fresh and flavorful, even without the dressing! I was very impressed. The pizza is actually made in a coal oven (you can see it) and was very good with a chewy perfectly doughy (yet crispy) crust.

bzGk6nS80sYqhL_7sz-Trw.text: I had the best seasalt chocolate chip cookie of my life at La Grande Orange during a recent layover in Phoenix.
