I live in California and do not have access to these incredible cookies on a regular basis.I am seriously considering going to Phoenix, just so I can get my hands on more of them!!

AE-1eJa-RH79Awk5I7t2OQ.text: Healthy choices, delicious food, and friendly staff makes for a pleasant long layover experience. Very pleased that I Yelped this place. I walked the concourse from the other side of the airport to get to this place and was pretty happy with my decision. Lots of options to choose from here including burgers, pizza, sandwiches,and salads to name a few. The dessert counter also looked quite tempting. You can either grab a meal to go or order and sit down on one of the many tables they have here. Plenty of space to plop open your laptop and to grab a quick bite to eat.   Big plus: They carry sriracha (rooster) hot sauce here as a condiment!

FxQa4ry5sjP5meVLH9USWw.text: Food is good, great for a quick grab and go too.  However, typical for HMS, service typically sucks.  If these people hate their jobs so much that they can't smile, say hello and thank you, they just need to stay home.   If it weren't for the staffing issues, they would have much a better rating.   The "real" location in town is great, if visiting, check it out.

6hVi7_-Dtob87DbWKNGvCQ.text: Cute, hip, and with healthy options, La Grande Orange offers the hungry, tired traveller some good eats away from home.   What I was most impressed about by this place (aside from the fact it is not only a pizzeria, sandwich shop, bakery, grill, and gelato shop!!!) is that they offer vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free options on their menu. They are well staffed and speedy.  I got their spicy chickpea lettuce wrap, which was chickpea, avocado, and sundried tomato on lettuce wraps since I was craving something filling, but healthy and not too heavy for my slightly upset tummy. Was very pleased with the size of it for the price, especially since it came with a little fruit salad! Cost me right around $8.   While waiting, I eyed other people's pizzas, burgers and fries, and baked goodies. All quality items!! Of note were their huge cookies, like the sea salt chocolate chip cookie.   Overall an amazing airport place. Would hit this place up even if it were not in an airport. Considering the prices, you wouldn't guess it to be airport food!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy chickpea lettuce wraps!

-lxeVviXiCLWvEonTNoikg.text: I ordered the guacamole BLT in between my flights and it was delicious! Of course, I was starving so maybe I'm a little biased but it hit the spot. It was pricey for what it was, but that is to be expected for airport food. The service with quick and friendly. If I'm ever back in the Phoenix airport flying Southwest and need a meal, I'll come back.

Hrd3BHgfRa_1HC9vuDqsCQ.text: This may be my new favorite airport simply because of this cafe. I didn't think I would find both vegan and gluten free options at an airport but this place has it all. The food was delicious, reasonable prices, great service and so many options. It was such a blessing to be able to sit down and enjoy a nice, hot meal.   I had the Zuni burrito (no egg, no tortilla). It had tofu, potatoes, spinach and mushrooms. It was hot and scrumptious and only $7.75. I also decided to try the Spicy Chickpea Lettuce Wrap which had two pretty big sized lettuce wraps topped with mashed garbanzo beans made with olive oil, red onions, celery, red bell pepper, cayenne pepper and paprika. It was all topped with fresh avocado and sundries tomatoes. It was only $7.50.   I also loved that this place had lots of sit down seating. You just get in line to order, then they call your name. There were several lines with different options. There was a pizza station (with vegan and gluten free pizza!), a sandwich/ salad line, breakfast food/burgers and this place even had a coffee bar with specialty drinks and baked goods (I didn't see vegan/ gluten free baked goods). I will definitely try to get more layovers at this airport so that I can eat here again. :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Zuni burrito, no egg, no tortilla. Delicious!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy Spicy Chickpea Lettuce Wrap!

mcRPhKkNhcQ_DIqFwG1aug.text: Had the Zuni burrito, which is a vegetarian burrito with tofu, spinach, potatoes, and eggs and it was delicious. Their salsa is mild and fresh. I really liked the taste of all of it. I would recommend this is you are at the airport traveling. Their service was nice and received my food fast.

Q8OrAAruwu556Pw0ZVBLvA.text: I ordered the maragrit pizza expecting it to look like the display pizza. When I reseved my pizza it had huge chuncks of in cooked cheese. I told them and instead of putting it back in the just said it was their style. After I talked to them I noticed they tood down the display pizzas. It was also overpriced. I wpuld not recomend.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My receipt
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My pizza

n2JRfEff_aA1A74pmF0ORQ.text: We arrived around 7:45pm and the restaurant next door already stopped serving food. Yet La Grande Orange  was operating at full force. What's more impressive was the quality and level of service delivered. The food was beyond expectations (mother of Earth pizza was fresh and pazole soup was super flavorful with legit pieces of chicken). Jeilani, the manager, was helpful and super involved with his staff. The workers were friendly and efficient and it was the best airport eating experience I've had.

GNjw3-lkZ583odfptJ2qjA.text: I only had the tuna melt, so I can't say the place merits five stars as a whole. But after paying way too much for a bagel, banana, and water at the San Francisco airport, the prices at La Grande Orange were refreshingly reasonable for airport food. And what's more: the tuna melt was REALLY good. The bread was hearty, fresh, and quite tasty. The tune was doctored up with some pleasant additives like yellow raisins which enhanced without overwhelming. The tuna was not the sopping-with-mayonnaise tuna-melt-tuna that you sometimes get (paid more for a lesser, overly-salty version in Carmel, CA, several days before). I mean, it was a really good sandwich (deserves two mentions). No idea what the rest of the food is like, but yikes: this is worth checking out.    No issues with service, as someone's complained about. Maybe just a good day, but credit where due.

ywAqlyPNR5I3WUIGYGezGQ.text: The pizza was pretty good. Price is high, but that is an airport. Ate here since I was in a time crunch to catch a plane. More places to eat outside of security check point. This was right next to my gate. Better than most airport pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dough was great. More toppings would be nice. Pricey.

WqLYvp-s6-M5D0s-R79-lw.text: So, let me start by saying that I NEVER review airport food venues because - quite frankly - they are generally gross and overpriced. BUt, I am making an exception for the BREAKFAST BURRITO here. This thing is PACKED with bacon and the salsa is extraordinarily good. We only bought one because they are $10 bucks (airport pricing) and not particularly large. BUT, as I sit here writing this review, I am pretty kisses I didn't one of my own and shared with my husband. He is eyeing the mine now and thinking of getting another! So, if you are on an early morning flight out of Phoenix, treat yourself to this for breakfast. Get 2 salsa cups! OMG MY HUBBY JUST GOT UP WHILST I WAS DOING THIS REVIEW AND GOT BACK IN LINE TO FET ANOTHER ONE! Wow!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XALJagT_0ghHgkpQSrfkJw.text: I was thrilled to find the vegan apple pie-cookie hybrid. I have never seen anything like it - it combines the best of an apple pie with the best of a cookie. It was delicious, I wish I had bought more of them. I'd love if they had even more vegan options (I think the spicy chickpea lettuce wraps were also vegan) but I will be back hoping they regularly serve the apple pie-cookie treat!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This vegan apple cookie was AWESOME

Ik94vfhNweHLiU_cejQLLw.text: Terrible.  Life is to short to spend $15+ on bad breakfast and coffee.  Two eggs, a slice of turkey (that was extra), and a wedge of honeydew Mellon (???), optional toast slice, and undrinkable drip coffee.  All I had was 2 eggs and 1 slice of turkey, for $15???  Skip this place and go anywhere else.

QF2LgnHX8zCO-J4HW7dGEQ.text: Favorite pizza place of Phoenix- only downside is they don't serve them until 9am! :( yes they are that good you will wish they had them earlier to grab one for breakfast or for a long flight! ($13 for a individual cheese)

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jk3juqaDToRjQ6SPK0-AAw.text: Fast, friendly service.  Pizza oven and a grill.  I had the green chile cheeseburger, which was quite good and reasonably priced for an airport.  Ice cream was good with a choice of several different flavors.  Plenty of seating, with room for carry-on bags.  Would eat there again.

Z-pbmNMB9u-ThpZVDap7Vg.text: If you are really hungry is the only way I'd eat here again! Ordered a cheese burger that cost me $14 and was the size of a baseball in diameter, I'd have rather had a McDonalds Big Mac and could have ordered 3 of them for this price!  Do yourself a favor and walk to the other end of the airport to get something better for the price! I'll never eat here again!

6xN9hXvQuuftlUC849uTWw.text: The place is nice and chef is friendly . My concerned  the pizza is doughy and hard to chew. Most of my pizza I just had the crust coz crunchy and crispy the way I  like it... Hopefully the can fixed they're dough...

UOkAN8CWpyb4MgFNsNErYQ.text: I had 2 quick layovers for my trip to and from Miami and I'm really glad that they stopped in Phoenix both times. It's not often you find decent airport food but La Grande Orange definitely altered my mindset on that. For those not as into sandwiches as I am, there are also pizzas, burgers, salads, omelettes, gelato soups, etc.   My girlfriend and I got the Stacked Turkey Sandwich both times and they were equally as amazing. I'm also a lover of all sandwiches, but this was unlike any airport food I've ever had. The contents were super fresh and they didn't skim on anything. It's a really great spot to grab a quick meal and the prices aren't terrible as well. They do stop making fresh sandwiches quite early, but the cooked foods are available until closing. Highly recommend if you have a stop in Phoenix!

tm9LsRG_KKJSEhGMnbu3tQ.text: Leaving Indy is always bittersweet. I had a great time with my co-workers, but it was time to return to reality. Thankfully, it helped to have a positive experience during my layover in PHX. My flight from IND to PHX was delayed so I thought it was going to miss the connecting flight. Good thing that was delayed too.  This gave me time to grab a quick bite to eat. It was late at night, but La Grande Orange was still open. Hallelujah! Probably wouldn't have eaten dinner otherwise. And the cashiers were so nice, which means a lot to a disgruntled traveler waiting for a delayed flight.  I got the chopped turkey salad, which was a good size and super cheesy. Yum! I took this to eat at a gate adjacent to mine since the shop was obviously closing down. I couldn't finish the whole salad but ate as much as my tired self could stomach. It was satisfying and saved me from hunger going home. If I had a layover in PHX again, I would totally come here, and it looks like many fellow Yelpers feel the same way!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vanq-9fMe3Kntt-Z3THvsA.text: Had some burgers. They tasted ok and were prepared to our liking. Downside was besides put on your own condiments, was the size of the burgers were exceptionally small. Somewhere inbetween a slider and a 1/4 lb from mcdonalds, $14. Came with some fries. Only have bottled & canned drinks, like a gas station but smaller selection.

ncq_L08GxgMBnmOV-oCUCg.text: Seriously.. if you're getting anything but LGO in this terminal, you're absolutely whack. LGO is absolutely phenomenal and the margherita pizza should be #1 on your order list. Every time. Barstool sports stool presidente Dave Portnoy would give this place a 10/10. Highly recommend. It's a heaven sent treat when my flight ends up in this terminal because I get to have LGO

vlueXxNLLhY2aBb_CRKmGw.text: Probably one of the worst breakfast burritos I've ever had no flavor besides the potatoes that were not so  good.very dry. no salsa. All around no so good. If I would have gotten some salsa that I helped give me some type of flavor

qDmR8_RTwVQ40BkXOntkJg.text: Typical airport food, low quality for a gourmet price. The workers were very unprofessional and were talking crap on another employee as I walked up, and didn't rush to finish the conversation so I had to listen to it for 30 seconds before they took my order. Wait time was extremely long considering it was an airport restaurant and people are usually in a rush. The sit down area was disgusting and workers were not responsive to customers. We would recommend moving on trying a different place in the airport next time you're going through.

2OtzliY5jjIRdWebeNHxng.text: Was looking forward to their "famous English muffin" and coffee while waiting for my morning flight. Coffee was very good and free refills! Whohoo! But the English muffin was not toasted, it was grilled for a nano second, so not toasty crispy  hot, and could taste the old oil product from griddle on the muffin. Disappointing. Left a bad taste in my mouth. Should have stuck with a croissant from Starbucks.

tiZGK2bt6mvKW6mn7OKQRg.text: I liked this place before I went vegan, but I like it even more now that I'm vegan since it can be hard to find restaurants with vegan options, especially ones who clearly mark the vegan items on their menu. I appreciated the coding on their menu which helped me zero in quickly on which items were vegan. I started with the Pizzeria Chop Salad, minus the cheese, which made it vegan. A lot of times when you take the cheese off a salad, it also results in taking off the flavor, but not in this case! The salad was very tasty and I wolfed it down. The Vegan Dalai Lama Pizza has cashew cheese on it, and it was very tasty. I added onions and garlic to it for free. I believe they have one or two options for vegan dessert, but I was so stuffed that I didn't inquire. Will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Dalai Lama Pizza (added garlic and onions)
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizzeria Chop Salad (minus the cheese)

3xqtVSl7Iqu8uRU143IUGg.text: Two stars because the servers were very nice and fast. The pizza was the worse pizza I'd ever had in my entire life. I couldn't even finish it. I don't know what they put on it but there was a horrible after taste, which was the only taste.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vRAvNiFcpquLgw03ctr2Pg.text: I had a layover in PHX and this place was literally right next to the gate for my next flight. By far and large the best food I have ever had at an airport in my life and rivals some of the best pizza I've had anywhere. What a find! I had the margherita pizza and it had perfect crust, perfect cheese, perfect tomatos, perfect everything. I also shared the kale and quinoa salad which was a wonderful mix of flavors (I am not a salad person). I also had the chocolate chip sea salt cookie and some chocolate pastry that looked a bit like a hostess cupcake. Both were amazing! The only thing that wasn't amazing was the honey latte (too much sweet, not enough espresso) but that's just my taste.  Seriously if I ever find myself in Phoenix, airport or town, I'm vlining for this place.

xnym_addQd0BeWwV3bvspw.text: The La Grande Orange on Campbell set the curve on grading the airports location. Just doesn't have the same quality and the service is obviously  different. Hey, I would definitely say this is better than the fast food shit you would normally see on concourses. The set up of this restaurant leaves a lot of people confused as well. No one knows where to order and pickup. That could be that I had to put my order in at the pickup counter.   Still a great place to pickup those muffins and latte before your flight.

q9D9yrClnd8XehcpR_dP_A.text: Thanks SkyHarbor for putting a great quick place like this in the airport.   It was packed as usual and La Grande Orange has the same great english muffins and homemade jams as the location on 40th and Campbell.      Nice friendly staff and a great selection.    It was the busiest place in the airport and worth the limited wait.

sByRR_TfZI0KbKHR2KqKGg.text: Seriously impressed. I had the vegetarian sandwich and it was full of flavor (and veggies!). Atmosphere leaves something to be desired, but that is because it is in the airport, which you've already forgotten because the food is so darn good you can't possibly be in an airport.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian sandwich. Lots of veggies, tasty cheese, and tasty bread.

g2ooYgV0d811OK3Hete44A.text: I love coming here, especially the main location in Arcadia by Postino.   great gelato, and everything else!!  defiantly a lunch spot all day long!

0dAn7DWob_4o14De2tZyhw.text: I have walked past LGO a dozen times because I thought it was just a coffee and snack place.  As it turns out, they have an impressive selection of fresh, green, and healthy creations ready for takeout for the hurried business traveler.  And for those in less of a hurry you've got sandwiches, burgers, pizza, and more cooked to order. I had the spicy chick pea lettuce wraps - I'm not a vegetarian by any means, but to my great surprise this dish not only tasted good, but actually filled me up too.    The layout of the joint was a bit confusing and the general flow of foot traffic needs improvement. I'll swing by for another bite next time I'm in this wing of the airport, especially considering the only other food option here is the less-than-average Mexican restaurant next door.

7DGkk7qI1a_PtKRKhkQuKg.text: Holy shit...the first bite of my burrito filled my mouth with the most incredible flavor! Omg this breakfast burrito is delicious!! Add Cheese its perfect!  Probably the best burrito I've ever tasted and I've had a lot on my 22 years of living in PHX. Geez I gotta go this burrito is off the hook, it cannot wait!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito add cheese! Enjoy the best taste of your life!

q-DUvR_Q1lZoBGIgI2M9RQ.text: Love LGO. Trendy, fast and a cute little breakfasty, brunchy joint on the weekends. Love all the coffee selections. The fact that you can even grab a Reisling from the refrigerator and hang out at the table and share! Tammie Coe cakes is also the baker of little fattening delicacies for the person you may have left home! Pizzas are yummy.. Salads even yummier and packaged to go, say if your a girl like me.. on the go.. on the fly! Parking is awful. Literally you may have to wait and mame to get a place on the weekends! Park up the street and walk!

WOG0LcwnxQyOkLGMz5YOlQ.text: Busy nice airport food.  Nice to be able to get a healthy meal in an airport and if after hours a glass of wine too boot!  I had the Kale salad which tasted pretty good, a shot of espresso (pick me up) and a sandwich all worked out well.  The only problem is the wait and getting seated.  If you have a group more than 4 probably not worth it.

sT6sdNsQjwW5CE_D74f62w.text: I've flown through Phoenix several times and never would have given this place a second look if I hadn't spotted all of the great reviews on Yelp. I got a gluten free Mother Earth pizza (easily large enough to share if you're traveling in pairs), a cup of fresh fruit, and an iced tea for a little under 30 dollars. The pizza crust is great and the produce tastes fresh. Great place to stop if you have an hour or so to spare between flights- like others have mentioned, it's not a place to grab a speedy snack.

Bfoe_RPEswBkcZb0dYUbcQ.text: Though it sucks to have a layover on a relatively short flight from LA to Albuquerque, this restaurant made the layover in Phoenix more than tolerable.   Thanks to Yelpers, I chose this place over several other seemingly attractive options and found a very unlikely food option in an airport. The place was a bakery, pizza spot and sandwich spot all rolled into one. At times, this can be bothersome, as specialization is key, but again, it's in an airport.   My wife and I were in sandwich mode and looking for something hot and we both found good options. I chose the Cubano hot pressed panini and my wife the hot pressed tuna sandwich. The prices were more reasonable than I'm used to from airports at about $7.50, so this provided some comfort.   When the food came, my cubano looked delicious and the taste did not disappoint. I thoroughly enjoyed it, even though I'd say a ham and cheese sandwich with pickles would be a more accurate description. My wife too liked her sandwich.   We had some cookies too and found them good, albeit sweet as all hell.   I'd seek this place out again if stuck in Phoenix in the future.

dmVA3TCtGfyWNAwtzh2KEA.text: We ordered pizza, sandwiches, and hamburgers. All came out in a timely manner and tasted pretty damn good.

3zSMildtt-6QH7nVXExleg.text: My favorite spot to grab a bite in terminal 4.  Great breakfast, lunch or dinner options.  Healthy, fresh and tasty.  I always grab a honey latte and a breakfast burrito as I board my flight...never disappoints.  The commuter sandwich is crazy good, eggs are cooked perfectly.  The airport versions are typically not nearly as good as the original restaurants, but La Grande Orange has done an admirable job when it comes to the quality of the food.

rrwP-JtYOZPVGfWlgNb6Jw.text: The ice cream is phenomenal! They use natural ingredients instead of the flavorings. Their strawberry flavor has quite a refreshing taste and I personally love their chocolate since it's rich and has more of a savory flavor.

F7IEOo6olfiX4kp3royBDQ.text: This is probably one of my best airport finds ever! For a moment, I thought I wasn't in an airport. The things I loved:  - variety - lots of different options ranging from ready made salads - think exotic, i got a kale, quinoa, parmesan, grape salad with a lemon vingette drizzle for about $9. huge box, big portion! Also some ready made sandwiches. You can order a more sit down meal as well. They have breakfast, lunch, and dinner. - price - amazed that I wasn't ripped off. I got a huge salad full of quality products, its not junk for your money. -fast: you can run in there like a mad storm, grab food and hop on your plane.  Overall, wish I flew through phoenix more often so I could eat here!

oUYvZke65sEnYUzuv-BYQw.text: Not a bad spot to hit up, it's airport prices that kind of throw me off from the food. But if you come here, get the California burger, it's a pretty perfect burger from an airport food service. Fries are alright, and they don't have any fountain drinks. But other than that, it's pretty decent.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California burger with fries

-OUlf8zo6HqjdFb0XprQBA.text: Awese Cuban sandwich with gruyere cheese! Lemonade was really good (ingredients were lemon juice, sugar, water and egg whites) cause it was super sour and yummy! I Would have given this place 5 stars, however I first ordered a honey latte, didn't like it, and they wouldn't let me exchange it. But go figure for airport food, right?

Ysj1w-gMqGpvWM-Gf88ogg.text: This place had tons of on the go options! I bought a pre made turkey sandwich and it was super yummy. They also have tables with plugs which is nice! Friendly staff and great airport food!

gEunqN2-rupcyNvHyfLGlw.text: Yum! Picked up the commuter sandwich on my way out of the airport and it was the perfect breakfast sandwich after a 2 hour flight. Pretty expensive though at $7 and the 2 bananas coming out to $3.50 or $4.00 but I guess that's the price you pay for convenience at an airport.  I will come back here if I have to fly through Phoenix again!  -Hungry Hungry Pongy

s-i87RYDs2wltr-2tDSy7g.text: Got it on my flight out. I ordered the green chili burger. The server was very nice, but the place was a cluster. There was no line and people just standing around.   After about 30 min I asked how much longer, I was told it would be 15 min when I ordered. They looked at my receipt and didn't even have it at their window. The guy had the cook make one in 3 min. I ordered it medium, so warm pink center, but I got it still somewhat raw in the middle. It still tasted decent but was expensive. I would not return to here, but their pizza looked good.

i-HB_f0NmLSFtizVPsYamA.text: This place is finally open! It opened today 10/6/12. It can be found in Terminal D. Things on the menu: eggs, oatmeal, other breakfast, burgers, pizza, salads, and a few other random things. The menu is reasonably priced. My breakfast cost $8 without a drink. I've been to the LGO locations within Phoenix.  PROS: - scrambled eggs tasted good, and had herbs - organic fruit was fresh and good - healthy options - fast service - salads can be taken to go - english muffins are sold individually, by the half dozen, and by the dozen  CONS: - bacon was very greasy and could have been much more crispy - include strawberry jam. Blackberry preserves doesn't taste very good. - signature english muffin was a little bit floppy due to the moisture in the plastic container. Maybe put the english muffin in a different holder? Small paper bag? - calling out names loudly is really annoying to listen to after 1 name. Maybe use a number system? Or provide a bigger waiting area?  Bottom line: I would come back, but I would probably order something else like the pancakes or a different egg meal. Or I would eat lunch/dinner here and try something else.

fe1juTxIxYJFY7JWBBv7zQ.text: Their orange juice is delicious, but for $16, this is by far, without a doubt, the most mediocre pizza I've ever eaten.

el8XYeQbwocpOPKzvSjHqw.text: Were it not for the absurd airport prices, La Grande Orange would be five-stars-worthy. I really like everything I have ever gotten there.   This is the first time I have had it in the airport, but I am fairly confident this is as good or better than anything else you could get nearby. Plus it's a Phoenix staple so if you have a layover and can't go into the city, it's worth it.

PeH2fzc2y76ffkunAVX6VA.text: Who woulda thought that the best Margherita Pizza I would ever have was here at the airport in Phoenix.  This is almost worth a separate trip!  It looks like they also do burgers, sandwiches, breakfast, and even sushi.    I'll have to stop by again and try the other menu items. Don't miss out if you are passing through!  I know I won't.

IacqRpCUJOCUL2JPfTXo0Q.text: Good place. They have fresh made and off the shelf options. Got a tuna melt and a veg sandwich: both were good and had unique flavors, like the pungent herbed goat cheese on the veg and the strong pickle in the tuna salad. Nice atmosphere, too.

3gb5P4DXMLelCuYDxPIPJw.text: I wanted to grab something quick while we waited to board our flight home to California and this was the only place that looked decent in our terminal. The seating area was packed with people and their luggage but I table opened up and we snagged it. I got in line to get our food and was handed a menu. There were a lot of options but it was mainly different combinations of the same thing. I ended up ordered a BLT, which took forever to make. and a breakfast burrito, which was the quickest. If Peets was closer to us (we were dead tired from Spring Training) then I would have just gone there and spent less money for better coffee and breakfast.   The BLT had a lot of avocado and bacon on it but it was not worth $9+ and the breakfast burrito, from what my boyfriend said, was okay.   I don't think I'd go back to this place unless it was the only option.

yPPXwyOohdVvW0IABaP5CA.text: Food is good but expensive and very slow if something needs to be cooked. Cook very disinterested which is a shame. A better place with friendlier people would make a killing.

e6_PFaw0YtPLUJg-ZVzLXA.text: In Terminal 4, Gate D. For airport food, this is the best I've had! You can't really compare airport food to outside food because, really, who WANTS to eat at the airport?! You eat at the airport because you're stuck there.  This place deserves the extra stars because I would actually eat at this place even if it wasn't in the airport, which I can't say about any other airport restaurant, except maybe one. I've spent  A LOT of times in airports! Trust me on this one. The food tastes extremely fresh and they have healthy options. I had the MOTHER EARTH PIZZA (full of delicious veggies), the mini cookies (they recommended the sea salt chocolate chip one, but the CHOCOLATE COOKIE was much better!!), the homemade english muffins (good, but not worth the $9 for 6), and the cute little ding dong things (good).  Definitely top 5 airport restaurants I've been to.

oGqj4EahQ4KJ0QZTYy4I9w.text: I purchased the yogurt parfait with granola while awaiting a flight. I have eaten numerous parfaits over the years, and this had to be the best. The yogurt was neither sweet nor tart, the fruit was abundant and fresh, and the granola had great texture and crunch. It really hit the spot.

ux8joi_fIHKxljcalxl7yQ.text: Good healthy choices at this establishment.  Fresh baked goods are offered as well. They have gluten free, non dairy choices. They have a great selection of salads and pizza & burgers. Not your typical airport fare.  Also available are prepackaged food & ready to go if you're in a rush to catch your flight.  A must try!!!!

aEmyj7YTfS2UCxyRun4KDw.text: The worse pepperoni pizza I had tried.....bad taste, terrible after taste, and too expensive for what it is.

BVhj2ZgjG3lPLtlDZ3jfJg.text: It's airport food - but better than other options. The OG is obviously WAY better but compared to the ones around it, it's a 5 star. Pizza, sandwiches, not many "kid friendly" options but there is Mommy Juice {aka wine} which makes travel days with littles more bearable.

tzaKVgk-TJ-YkjVXL7dMug.text: My favorite airport restaurant, and I work for the airlines. Get the kale quinoa salad and the sea salt chocolate chip cookie. Pizza here is also delicious.

t2myac4dMWrbbtuFCuYNmw.text: Expensive and slow..  the first time I ordered a gluten free Margherita pizza with pepperoni and it was just alright.  Second time at this airport I ordered the green Chile burger.  I asked for it cooked medium.  I was in a rush to get to my plane so I grabbed it and ran once they called my name.  Got to the airplane and went to eat my burger and the patty was so raw the middle was falling apart and my bun was soaked in blood... blood and oil was also pooling in the bottom of my box and soaking into the fries.  Wish I took a picture.  I was starving so I ate the fries that weren't touching it... I won't say don't eat here because you have limited options but have time to sit and eat or at least check your food before running off.  They also have items that don't require cooking which may be a better option and what I should have done.

kKXqn-24NBW4oCuBwBEtrA.text: This place is SOOO expensive. I couldn't believe how much a burger costs and a pizza.  I mean they were good but really, I could feel my entire army of kids with 1/3 of what we paid for both of these meals.  To make matters worse, I didn't know where the heck to pick up the pizza we ordered.  There weren't any signs or anything.  We stayed on the left side near the fridge because we ordered on that side.  We received our drinks and our burger on that side but when I asked about our pizza, the workers were looking at me oddly and then treated me horribly like I was supposed to know to pick up the pizza on the other side.  Really people.  I want to give this place even less stars but the food was actually good.  Boo to getting food at the airport and rude people.

PbDfXPUpbxCO07OJr_YeSA.text: Airport food. Nothing like getting heart burn before a long flight, eh? But, this place wasn't too bad! Had a burger and fries, cooked to order, and it was pretty good. OK... I've now officially written an airport food review. Wonders never cease.

AjU7ni-pr3Z5wiibjDAEVA.text: Very nice that you can eat LGO in the airport before (or after!) a flight. The menu is smaller but the basic core items are there. I enjoyed a light, tasty veggie sandwich. I liked the mix of vegetables and I didn't feel heavy or greasy after eating it. The burgers people were ordering looked delish. My friend got a breakfast sandwich which he thought was pretty good but that the bun was a bit stale. Even though LGO is famous for their buns, we were thinking maybe the airport location doesn't always get to enjoy the super fresh quality that the Arcadia location gets to. Either way, it was still good.  Next time I am at the Phoenix airport I will definitely stop by.

q0vtfLmoau6Co7fBKmgyZg.text: Note to self: GO HERE the next time I'm peckish and waiting out a hellish Phoenix layover. La Grande Orange offers fresh food, lots of veggie options, and a friendly, efficient staff. There's also great seating for people watching, and a fantastic beer list that offers various local choices.

e9X3oyDahW7rfNwd_Um2Iw.text: SO glad I was able to get food from here instead of my usual muffin & crappy cup of coffee from Starbucks.  It was about 530am & they were extremely busy but very helpful.  I ordered an english muffin, a honey latte & some sea salt chocolate chip cookies to take to my family back home.  My order came out quickly & the english muffin was huge, very fluffy.  The star of the show was the honey latte...mmm. No bitter, burnt taste, just smooth yummy coffee! My family & I loved the chocolate chip cookies! I'm a sucker for anything salted! I will be visiting their other location to try out more of their food. Can't wait!

qKr0VrFrfo2ym15YV1QgZg.text: Got the egg white and turkey omlet with the avocado/tomato salsa. It was awesome that they used a real egg. Everything looks like it was made today, not brought over pre-made in a Sysco truck. Good service. Good food. It was a little bit on the salty side, but for airport food, solid.

itkpavD9oCTszX1kuoQC_g.text: GET THE ENGLISH MUFFINS YOU FILTHY BASTARDS !!! You will not find a better one in all of the land!! I absolutely love this place!! Everything is fantastic!! The even have beer and wine here !! Do your taste buds a favor and try one of everything !!

34w2f4vQqhQA8XCLQvXKAA.text: Stopped here for an adult beverage to kill time before my flight. Ordered the gluten-free sausage pizza with Fresno chilis. It was a crunchy thin delicious pizza. The bartender was super nice and helpful. I have eaten breakfast here before and it's pretty good as well. Highly recommend!

f0Df9GSHfv3SiCd9bDfeSQ.text: LGO at the airport is great - the pizza salad is my go to when I'm at the airport and need lunch/dinner. The tea is also excellent and great for a flight.   LGO offers breakfast, pizza, hot/cold sandwiches, AND salads! Pretty much everything you could want at a quick, fresh place. They even have things for the sweet tooth!

ztwxxfXOEEJHz0L4E_iVZA.text: Like night and day compared to my last visit five years ago. Service was very helpful for an airport restaraunt. Plenty of seating. Good pizza (try the fallen angel). Very reasonable prices by airport standards. Will be back.

LcRQekxGgYHmSNdFatkqpw.text: Overall decent price for what you get, though their line system was a bit confused as you can line up in 2 separate lines, but you see different menus (pizzas & sandwiches & coffee vs burgers and other entree options)... which left me to order a sandwich when I could've ordered a hot burger instead. Would be nice to have both menus up on both sides, or at least centered so you can see it from either line. Putting in your order was fast, but waiting for any non pre-packaged meals took a bit of time. Staff was courteous and it's nice they ask for your name so it's easier to tell when your order is ready. Good amount of seating, but it's open and located near a bunch of a gates, so it'll be hard to nab a seat.

A8KjJmcsjwoQFdCZ7qegpw.text: For what it is I can't complain. Airport food and airport dining isn't always the best experience but LGO doesn't a decent job at it. Fresh dough, wood fired pie, and decent service.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita

mfesxJ7DL2rBcP6F3OO6RA.text: Not same quality food, staff, nor drink as real LGO. Don't think the staff knows how to make a latte. Mine had burnt almond milk tasted like fart juice.

K4T3ZIcVO-drXYqrAyJn9w.text: Food is pretty good but over price as expected because it's inside the airport... but the wait!!!! If you order hot food (besides pizza that's already baked), you WILL wait 15 minutes for your food. Yes they take your order fast but the food takes forever. Pretty annoying especially when you have a flight to catch in a couple minutes. Do try their salads though, they are delicious.

Hnjs3ppJxAlGMOkMPs_NwQ.text: I understand it is still airport foot, but I was disappointed in my burger at the la grande orange airport location. Call me crazy but the quality of ingredients at the airport location does not match its Arcadia location. My burger was tiny in size. Would have probably ordered pizza but they were all "grab n go". I'm good

wmdzJdzwuXO7yKo2Ag4RPQ.text: The absolute worst service I've ever received from LGO. They close at 9pm, yet they would not make a salad at 8:10 and their kitchen was closed. The manager said that's the rules. My options were 3 salads in the fridge or he told me I could order pizza, which I can't eat.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w0t1HJxHenaNiVtCyn7C8g.text: The food here was decent. They have a lot of options here. They have pizza, sandwiches, omelets and more. They have grab and go pre-made stuff but also have fresh, made-to-eat food that is fresh and good. I had eggs over easy with turkey and toast. I could have chosen from several other meat options. There was also a healthy slice of musk melon. Not bad for about $10.  I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs made to order
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ImA6RGC6QQVZZq_0kKkpzw.text: Decent food. Large selection. Airport pricing  Not much more to say  Decent food. Large selection. Airport pricing  Not much more to say  Decent food. Large selection. Airport pricing  Not much more to say  Decent food. Large selection. Airport pricing  Not much more to say  Decent food. Large selection. Airport pricing  Not much more to say

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Busy at 7:45 PM
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No messin&#39; around quick and tasty

SDt0cOxMZO1ghrmWi09afA.text: What a mess this place is. DIRTY Totally unorganized , no vegan cheese and the "order taker" had no idea what vegan was , didn't even know what arugula  was! Completely clueless!    There is a roped off area with NO SERVER and absolutely no help what so ever! This place totally unorganized, NO TAP beer.... the bottled beer is basic and you have to get the beer take it to the register to have them open it and hand it back - with No glasses!   Untrained,. Unprofessional, unwilling to help.... I won't go there again.

YTZp39sPTNUAXmjAD72e5A.text: Guys.  I am not a two star reviewer.    Seriously-look at my reviews.  This was such a terrible meal that I had to review on the off chance that some manager will see this and adjust.    I'm giving an extra star for a really nice guy who handed me my salad, but the food was really, really one star worthy.  This place has been my go-to on my many Phoenix connections for a healthy, quick meal to go.  In the past, this place has been solid.  The last time I'd been, I've had a sandwich that has been borderline "airport food" vibe--soggy bread, processed lunch meat, etc-- but it was pre-made, so I get it.  That was on me.  This I opted for the Thai chicken salad that was made-to-order.  It was not good, y'all.  Chicken was completely unseasoned--like, no taste.  Lettuce was 100% chopped iceberg.  Dressing was oil.  Not like "vinegar and oil based dressing"--like I shook it up, dipped my first bite in it, and I got a mouthful of lettuce and oil.  I had five bites and legit feel my stomach churning.  I had to stop.  If I hadn't grabbed this to go and run to my flight, I'd have legit taken it back to ask if it was a mistake, but I just scrolled through recent Yelp to see pics, and it looks like it was not a mistake.  And I'm not fancy--I eat at Taco Bell as often as I eat real food.  Anyway, if you're reading this, dear manager, please try the Thai Chicken Salad.  It's not good.  It's not like "some people won't like this"--I have a lot of room for varying tastes.  This just isn't good.  But the guy who handed it to me was super nice.  So thank you to him.

nA9QlGUzS9PCtFotOx3ieQ.text: Salted chocolate chip cookie the size of your head? Yeah, this place is right up my alley! I took a little walk over to this terminal just to get the cookie and I like to think I burned off 1/8 of the cookie doing so. They have two cashiers inside the restaurant for fast and easy ordering!

p95_4ulmpd-6uPMRI6--oA.text: The food is just a tad overpriced BUT it's good! No complaints on my burger. Service on the other hand was horrible. When we went up to order she had an attitude on her like we bothered her... We forgot all about her once food was handed to us. It was so delicious. I was going to put 3 stars but the food made up for it! Whoever the chef was you are fantastic!

zhinw-Uywo1_7BDpYSX8FQ.text: Best posole soup I've eaten in a long, long time. Didn't expect it at the airport. It was even cleaner and tastier than the one I tried at Barrio Queen, which I also enjoyed.

U7FEbV_-Y9bydpS7RZNwoQ.text: Had a surprisingly good gluten free pizza... the "Mother Earth" was a flavorful and satisfying veggie pizza large enough to share as a couple, and good enough for the non-gluten free meat lover! Also had good iced tea, and helpful friendly staff.

JZFCv2CKCMPutU3o_tHAcg.text: By far the worst experience I've ever had at any food establishment in an International Airport. Slow, unfriendly staff that ignored customers and requests, and overpriced poor quality food. I partly blame the Phoenix Airport for having nothing but this dump in the D wing ad an option for food.  In hindsight I would have rather gone hungry than go to this garbage dump establishment

kWqhHDG0_fUGCKz7PXgcLg.text: Really disappointed. I used to love getting a salad here before my flights, and I'm sad to say that they have become very chinchy with portions. All of the salads look like they are half the size they used to be, not to mention they are ridiculously priced at $11-14. I'm a small person and it wouldn't fill me up.

dBMNMT9nBLB2Yb_Ys1-2TA.text: Had the open faced breakfast sandwich with ham, Gruyere cheese, egg, tomato and I think avocado. On grilled bread. Wow! Was unexpectedly delicious! Probably way too many calories and fat grams and a tad bit greasy but it was worth it! Highly recommend this place for breakfast. Coffee was so-so.

6XelDtvF5e-lTtulrLqAOw.text: Got a salad to go. Not bad, kinda hard to go wrong with a salad. Maybe just the price could be a little lower

dooi8QtoQ2u96PvUCgZl_A.text: Had an hour in between connections.  We like Paradise better.  Ordered the cubano and it was pipping hot but the flavor is okay.  Cookies were big (peanut butter, butterscotch oatmeal) but they were not chewy.

54ISoRLfuETzwnjRfq4h4g.text: We were headed back to Pizzeria Bianco & saw this place on Yelp as another option too. We didn't have a chance to visit the actual restaurant of either when we were in Phoenix so when we were at the airport & saw this place we were so excited!   It was so delicious!!!! We got the fallen angel and the sonoma salad and they were both amazing. Definitely not cheap but to get gourmet food at the airport was totally worth it versus same price at some other place!  Crust, toppings and cheese were amazing! The salad was fresh and had a great mix of ingredients!  We will be back for sure to this or the main location!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fallen Angel yummyness :)

_7_-shA2VSKlhQB3wjWu2g.text: The vegetarian sandwich was delicious.  The service was fast and the people pleasant, not jaded as some personnel are at airport restaurants.

x1KB2U8SW6RHJpAN54K28A.text: Would be a 4-star in normal circumstances, but compared to most fast airport fare, this is a 5-star.  I have eaten meals here twice and stopped here several times for coffee and a treat.  Each time has been quite good.  For food, I've tried a burger and also a hot sandwich, and each were good.    I enjoy the cold-brewed iced coffee very much, so that's my recommendation if you're not traveling at mealtime.  Get yourself an iced coffee with two $.75 mini-cookies, pour in some half-and-half and you have an excellent snack before hopping on your plane.    If you arrive in terminal D, grab an iced coffee to go and drag it out of the terminal on to your rental car bus.  It is a great pick-me-up to nurse for the whole day.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Power outlets in the big tables

Niucc9ZX9v5vmjSTiu8c1Q.text: Worst breakfast ever. Toast was not toasted and omelet had RUNNY EGGS. OMLETS ARE NOT SUPPOSED TO HAVE RUNNY EGGS!!!! OMLETS was watery and greasey. $16.25 for this garbage. It's not like they were busy either. They could have taken their time... I will not be coming back here again.  Update: got a refund. Changed to two stars.

i4aV23DfqZnkxR4MhxDz7A.text: Healthy lunch option in the airport. Got a delish kale quinoa salad before my flight that I really enjoyed! Lots of sandwiches and salads to choose from along with baked goods should you desire. Serves breakfast food until 5 pm. Check it out if you're in the Phoenix airport.

WUi0-zsZ0_eDoH7yYqZ-KA.text: Love that LGO is at the PHX airport - great place to stop in for breakfast, lunch or dinner!  I dropped in yesterday on my way to Orange County and got a mint tea and the 7th heaven muffin - delicious way to kick off an early morning!

2UXSBWLpKXJeQo7m3Rdjiw.text: Cold ham on the breakfast sandwich just like a deli sandwich with lunch meat.   Very disappointing. Menu says it comes with avocado yet they are out but still charge you full price?!? Come on... Bread isn't toasted? Is this even a breakfast sandwich? No such thing as light mayo can be ordered.  I wouldn't come here again. Over priced for what you get. BYOS bring your our sandwhich! It's probably better.

ehLGnBy96Htgpdir3yFKNg.text: Who would have thought that one of the best salads I've had in a long time would be in the Phoenix airport?    The kale and quinoa salad is a must-order for anybody craving vegetables and looking for something to take on a long flight toward the east coast.  The kale and other sturdy vegetables stand up well to sitting in a plastic clamshell without getting soggy.  The quinoa adds an incredibly pleasant nuttiness and crunch.  The dressing is tangy and rounds out the dish.  Over a week later, I am still thinking about how to replicate this salad, and I can't think of the last time I've felt that way about airport food.  (I didn't care for the grapes and thought the salad would have been better without them-- but I'm not docking this review to four stars, because IT WAS AN AIRPORT.)

1kbswmJNHdbmI60dHzTHnQ.text: should have thought it over a little bit more before I tried this place. it was busy so that was a good sign.  as I walked in there was a lady with a half eaten kale salad so I thought that would be a healthy lunch.  I pick up the kale salad that costs $11.  cashier wasn't friendly at all.  it looked tasty but it wasn't.  no taste and I didn't finish most of it.  I thought about the lady I saw with her half eaten kale salad and I think it was half eaten because she didn't like it either.   never again.

0VTa0kmllKbbS3zy5y91WA.text: Ive eaten here several times and i always get the zuni burrito which is tofu chorizo. Im not vegan but i like it. The wait today was ridiculous though. Normally i get my food in a reasonable amount of time but thus time...  Fortunately, i was just dropping my son off and was not in a rush.

olCCuGmhOf22yaiOfkNNFg.text: LGO goes back to 5 stars for me. As soon as I expressed disappointment in the error in my recent order they reversed the charge and reached out to me to ensure that everything was addressed. They clearly care deeply about the satisfaction of their valued customers and I truly appreciate that. I never planned to stop coming here since I love there food so much, but it adds to the experience to know that I'm valued as a customer and that my voice is heard. 5 stars. Kudos LGO. Here's to more commuters in my future!

jFBDbnKALHnSBiLUZCyNCQ.text: Great food - at an airport!! Who knew this was possible? I ordered the chopped turkey salad. It was delicious. Fresh ingredients and a tasty combination of flavors. Just what I needed.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy!

VgYTPFqAJRkA2RnK9z8NRw.text: For an airport restaurant, this place had an excellent pizza and salad bar! I had the "Mother Earth" pizza w broccolitini  shrooms. Onions, tomatoes artichokes and more = YUM - fresh oven baked thin crust , just the way I like it!  Also had the shredded kale and quinoa salad and w the house dressing = really good!  This is not solely vegetarian;  You can also get burgers etc , plus your coffees / espressos.

a-55tRLJRUvYN8T33wVaHA.text: So you're flying out of PHX and after passing thru security you see La Grande Orange.  Guess what, you win!  La Grande Orange at PHX is a staple in the valley between the Tammy Coe cupcakes and the awesome pizzas and salads this place comes up a winner.  Jump in and be grateful your gate is here.  Have a safe flight!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita Pizza

Y0wlx0pEr-Ek9qP8McvJIA.text: It was a little crazy during the morning rush.   - Cubano was tasty.  Bread was nicely toasted. Good proportion of mustard, ham, pickle, and cheese. Price was a little high for the amount of sandwich though.  - 9 Grain Tuna was  delicious.  Good amount of sweetness from the pickles and golden raisins.  Moist enough, but not soggy.  The green apples and cucumbers gave it a nice crunch. - PB&J was alright. Bread was a little dry and they were a little heavy handed with the jelly.   - Blackberry Dumpling was really tasty. You get a flaky crescent-like pastry with a blackberry base.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 9 grain tuna
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cubano

9ndNSoLf5Eukznj2fTa0HQ.text: This rating is solely for the chocolate, gluten free cookie!   Not the chocolate chip! Just the cookie that is completely brown like a brownie!  This is the love baby conceived by a cookie and a brownie. The shape is, of course, a cookie. But the texture is chewy like a brownie, has a crackly top like a brownie. There's even walnuts like a brownie. It's the best cookie I've ever encountered, and believe me I've had my fair share of cookies!   And if this should be categorized as a brownie, it's the best brownie I've ever encountered, and I've also had my fair share!   I often book flights with connections in PHX, just to get this cookie! I'll walk from any terminal, just to get this cookie!!   BELIEVE ME!! I think it's Gluten Free too and I'm not even about that life!   They have it in the large size and also baby sizes. Both are equally good!  The place also offers sea salt chocolate chip cookies, butterscotch cookies, etc.  All are really good but none compare to the chocolate cookie.  Next time I'm in PHX, I'll edit this review with pictures too! :)  In terminal 4 or D

umsaeFK4bX5nVQcSEZBngg.text: Hi, may I have the Cuban please? Very rudely, "Uhhh, you mean The Cubano?"  Oh, not a good way to start our little transaction here.  Well let me tell you that your little Cubano is horrible. I'm pretty sure if I owned a George Foreman Grill, had some miracle whip (CUBANS DON'T HAVE MAYO!!), Oscar Meyer ham, Vlasic pickles, and week old stale bread, I could still whip up a better sandwich than you served me. And probably quicker than in the 10 minutes it took you to make it.  I definitely won't be returning here.  Rude service, terrible sandwich, and too long of a wait, especially in an airport location.

INUJg-GgfL54bwVl_3hkNw.text: I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE LGO! When you're flying they're definitely your go to restaurant!  They have delicious grab and go options. The salads taste so great it almost seems like it's too good to be healthy. The pizzeria salad is full of greatness ! I love substituting the lettuce   for just spinach. It really brings out the pizza ingredients in this salad    My favorite is most definitely the personal pizzas! They're a bit pricey but what can you really do about it. You're in the airport and everything is more just like the mall. Haha  I must say it's worth the price, especially when you customize your pizza to your liking. Mother Earth pizza is just pure deliciousness!  It is fully loaded with many vegetables that you can barley see the cheese . Please note  you can definitely taste the cheese! Haha!   Mother Earth Pizza  is recommended   It's so filling and full of delicious diversity with textures and flavors!   Last but definitely not least, they have amazing Orange  juice !! I mean come on it's La Grande Orange    This restaurant and crew are always on point when I come here! Thank you for making the time I spend in Skyharbor airport a enjoyable one!   I enjoy the optimal service that I receive every time I'm in Skyharbor airport. The staff is very friendly in the front and it's also very refreshing to see the cooks smiling as they prepare food for

njs6JlLEM8hs9iAMxjwLrA.text: Ok so In this review, keep in mind I will compare apples to apples. This is a quick counter food place in the airport...not a fancy sit down restaurant  and so I will compare to other airport food places.   It has a long counter you can work on your laptop or people watch. I grabbed a foil wrapped premade breakfast burrito, orange juice and coffee cake. The burrito was pleasantly delicious. Hot great egg potatoes bacon ratio and salsa had good flavor. I'm picky about my OJ and let me tell you this OJ was soooo good. Also had a little sweet tooth so ordered the coffee cake which is one of my favorites. It was a little dry but flavorful.   Overall I like this place better than any others in this area and I have tried others. This is located in terminal 4 Gate D.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bakery items look good
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsa

I82zSpTbwiEkMEV5wg-kPg.text: It's a well known Valley restaurant in the airport. It's hard to hold the same standards you get at the home office. Here's the skinny. The food is pretty good. We had the Ricky Martin breakfast burrito with a side of the guacamole & chips. All pretty tasty but the guacamole is super fresh and delightfully uncomplicated. Not that green ooze restaurants sometimes try to pass off as guacamole.  We sat at the bar and had the best service I've ever had in an airport restaurant. Olivia and her partner were fantastic! I hope we fly out of concourse D again in the future.

kmpSTpVXVWFg1PKzivbuZA.text: This was a quick stop for food between flights - knowing Southwest only provides snacks on the long flight ahead.   Never heard of the big orange  but this spot was crowded while the adjacent restaurant was nearly empty.   The space is semi-circular with four "stations" along the inside perimeter and seating on the outside. No table service, strictly order and find a seat. The stations included a Beverage section for alcohol, wine and beer a Burger station for grilled sandwiches and burgers, a Sandwich station for cold wraps and other sandwich fare and a Pizza station for personal sized build your own pizzas. Basically all the food groups and something to wash it all down!  We opted for a moderately healthy choice, turkey on Levain (sourdough) bread. We found that all the cold sandwiches were premade that day, AND , we both wanted something slightly different than the menu (no tomato on one, no avocado on the other). As we suggested to the cashier we would deconstruct the sandwich, she offered to have new ones made to order! Boom! Instant fans.  Sandwiches were both good and fresh and reasonably priced for airport fare. Definitely would recommend if you need feeding in the terminal

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burgers and wraps

aPfC3N8wpsm99SAz08KoSA.text: Not bad for airport food but it comes with an airport price tag. The pizza I wanted, Gladiator, wasn't in the warmer so they made one fresh, to order. It took about 10 minutes +/-  The pizza was pretty greasy (so if you get one, take lots of napkins). The pizza sauce actually had some chunks of tomatoes which was nice. The sausage & pepperoni were good, although there wasn't much for the price, over $16 for a small 10 inch pizza. The crust was also good, but a tad chewy.   It was filling (although I wasn't very hungry) and I might order one again. It was just good, not great. But the people working there were very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gladiator Pizza, could have used a little more meat- appx $16
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza box

-cFVC_6Lc0_V2eb3zDehmw.text: Being gluten free and having options for food can be limited while traveling. This place was a pleasant surprise. I was sitting next to a lady that was eating a delicious looking pepperoni pizza from this place and couldn't help walk down to try this place. There is NO up charge for gluten free crust, which is not common but much appreciated. I ordered the Margarita on gluten free crust, it was a 15 minute wait while they baked it in their wood fired oven. The pizza was about $15 which is decent for gluten free pizza. I was quite thrilled by the price and flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita pizza on gluten free crust

o_Scln4qNgiUcctSLS1GXQ.text: LGO definitely is a good option while waiting for a flight. They have a variety of dishes to suit most diets, including spicy chickpea lettuce wraps for gluten-free vegans or anyone looking for a healthier option. They also have made-to-order pizzas and breakfast dishes, pre-packaged salads and sandwiches, and various baked goods including super-sized cookies. There are several open coolers with bottled water, sodas, Red Bull, and other beverages. The front of the restaurant has a decent sized seating area with tables that are on a first-come, first-served basis.  Although the spicy chickpea lettuce wraps are tasty, they could greatly benefit from a touch less heat and some salt. They're somehow on the cusp of being offensively hot, yet surprisingly bland. I'd also ditch the sun-dried tomatoes. They're slimy and unnecessary with the cucumbers, avocado, and pickles already served on/with the wraps. That of course is my personal preference, but since these are a pre-made dish, it would be nice to see those eliminated.

-DmFcWHfm5gCAEgavKoQ9w.text: Kind of expensive but good! The cummuter sandwich with avacado was good but bland, the chocolate pastry "Old timer cupcake" I got was really rich and thick like a cake pop. I spent $13 without a drink for a small breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cummuter sandwich

QI1MS3D-nCcO1wtvj-v45Q.text: I had EXCELLENT service from Jelani the great! What a class act businessman who cares about the service of his customers. Travel can be rough but Jelani will put a smile on your face and make great recommendations of what to try. I most definitely will stop by again on my travels. LGO gets my vote! Go see Jelani. I had the chocolate gelato and sampled the cookie & cream.... absolutely delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4kOsGkJR4DV9ZjEBGVJhlw.text: Heading to the east coast from SFO yesterday my flight was delayed due to weather so was re-routed to fly to Phoenix before heading onward.   Famished I saw a sign in the Phoenix airport that said the Phoenix Airport was the tastiest & friendliest airport in America. I was to put that to the test stopping at La Grande Orange for a Zuni Burrito.  The Zuni Burrito is a whole wheat tortilla w/ tofu "chorizo", mushrooms, spinach, potato, & comes w/ a charred tomato salsa.  Normally it comes w/ egg whites yet my friendly server knowing I was vegan suggested customizing it by replacing the egg whites w/ avocado.  I appreciated the recommendation as the burrito hit the spot. One of the better airport burritos I have had in some time.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vjDyXODw1nqAPeSaN1JJSA.text: At the Phoenix airport and need a quick bite or drink?  I got the Gladiator pizza - not worth the price, but hey it was 9pm and I was waiting for a flight...  so a bottle of soda and the personal size pizza and I paid roughly $18.  It did the job.  They also have a wall of cold drinks and water, chips, burgers etc.  Would I eat there again?  Well if in the airport, probably...  but I'd definitely try some other places first.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gladiator pizza (pepperoni and sausage)
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3ua2M4jP--nWty6-Hlt_MA.text: Enjoyed the custom burrito with avacado and no bacon immensely.  I will definitely be back so I can try the monsterous vegan apple cookie.

w6QJS9KwAKcF3NXODzVBrQ.text: Stopped by here during a layover in Phoenix. There was no line here compared to other places, which was nice. I grabbed the Margarita pizza, but they also had burgers, salads, sandwiches and even gelato.  The pizza itself was a good size and was on par price-wise with everything else in the airport. Overall, the pizza was okay, nothing spectacular but still did the job.

JloSOPmfafqUxv_wS5WYoA.text: Pretty hot day in Phoenix. I arrived at the airport very thirsty. Walked into La Grande Orange and asked for ice in my water bottle as the little water it was hot.  Megan, with her captivating smile, gladly took my bottle and filled it with ice.  As a non paying customer I was treated with the highest respect.

OvmRo7yT9j5DUxiQoQxiLg.text: While on a layover at the Phoenix Int'l Airport on our way to So Cal, my wife and I were on a search for lunch options. When we arrived at gate C19, we quickly checked the monitors for our departure gate for our connecting flight leaving in a couple of hours. The monitors indicate gate B6 so off to B6 we went where we came upon Le Grande Orange. After reading favorable Yelp reviews and seeing they have a wood-fired oven for making pizzas, we opted to order a pizza to share.  We ordered their Gladiator pizza ($16.50) which came with huge slices of pepperoni and sausage. All pizzas were personal-size but we weren't all that hungry so we shared one. The pizza was good, with a nice chewy crust with just the right char.  All in all, a very good pizza at the airport, albeit a bit pricy. Was going to give it 3 stars, but after considering its airport location, decided to give them 4 stars instead. Quick lunch for 2 came out to just under $21.  Oh yeah, good thing we re-checked the monitors again as our departure gate was changed, moving us back to gate C19.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gladiator pizza...are you not entertained?
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You can see the wood-fired oven all the way back

kwGYxb0KVf2-nDGNA55v5g.text: If I could give it lower I would.  This is not even close to Pizza. Why is it the airport food is traditionally so nasty and the most expensive and we take it. This food was awful. The personnel were pleasant and only following recipes and as stated it was awful. I don't give bad ratings normally even if I don't like it but this was total disappointment. Do yourself a favor and don't eat there for at least the pizza

RM9YkE6tpQL_vXt_WBrHEA.text: Like most airport restaurants, prices are inflated. However, you won't a better bang for your buck at Sky Harbor International Airport. It's quick and easy.  Some decent items you might consider trying: bbq purged and fries are good for the meat lover. For the salad lover, try the chicken salad. This is one of the few places where it normally comes without mayo. If you need an alternative, try their pizza. But whatever you do, be sure to be room for a cookie!

jKKMZwfXDE9HyTCP0yWAzg.text: Decided to stop in here for a quick bite before our flight. They carry a nice selection of pre-made sandwiches and salads to grab and go. There is also a decent menu to choose from.  The seating area is comfortable and spacious.  Our Thai chicken salad and chicken salad wrap were  tasty.  Ingredients were fresh, and portion sizes were generous.  Prices were fairly reasonable for airport food. The wrap was $10.75 and the salad was $10.15.  Would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bF9GhC_q3tTFjK9Qz3uz_Q.text: In this day and age is it really necessary to swamp this earth and our oceans with copious amounts of La Grande Orange plastic?  Really?  Plastic bag... holding my plastic wrapped plastic utensils and plastic box salad.  Ohh yeah! In the plastic boxed salad there are two plastic containers holding two kinds of salad dressing.  Each with plastic lids.  Let's not forget the plastic cup for tea.  All of this to sit down and eat inside the establishment.  I will not come back at least until someone in this company has a revelation that maybe they use too much plastic.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La grande orange plastic before it ends up in our oceans.

Pf1S2_LbFsWZzwoIz3fZ_Q.text: Hands down the best place to eat at the PHX airport, IMHO.  Although it is expensive, the food is fresh, delicious, and you can't beat the grab and go when you're in a rush.   Some of my fave vegetarian options include:  The Quinoa and Kale salad - this is an obsession of mine and my fellow flight attendants!  I crave it all the time.   Chickpea Lettuce Wraps - ask for a side of their homemade ranch to go with this, it's the perfect complement and really makes the dish delicious  The Mother Earth Pizza - if you like vegetables as much as I do, you will LOVE this! Broccolini, artichokes, olives, bell peppers and more are in this wood fired pizza. I always balk at the price ($16.5 for a personal? Really?) but it is absolutely delicious and great to share with a friend if you both want to try multiple things.   Their soup of the day always changes, I've had the Tomato Basil (it was bomb!!) but it sometimes takes them a while to get anything out that isn't already made.  Just a note for those of you in a rush!

_Ehbt8dbRupEW2lXWpn6Cw.text: Great little place to wait for you plane in Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix. I found a corner with a table and an outlet to plug in my laptop to enjoy a latte and catch up on some work. The sandwiches are good. I saw some people with pizzas, pastas and salads. Not your normal airport food.

kYVxZAK--Kn6yGd747uY9A.text: Sea salt chocolate chip was better than the butterscotch oatmeal. Both were still pretty good.  The smaller cookies are $1.50 each and is a yummy snack or dessert.

KRr-dXxd3TlCzl1ntg6yKw.text: So, I am trying to eat a little healthier because I have been gaining weight lately =bad.  I grabbed the spicy chickpea lettuce wraps a couple mayos and ketchups thinking they may need some help... Boy was I wrong!! Didn't need either the ketchup or the mayo.. Would've been a total mistake. These things should be called spicy Umame Bombs! Holy Shit! It's all  going on in there! Spicy, savory, sweet (sweet pickles... Genius!!!) Fresh, crunchy. My mouth is on fire!  Totally satisfying (good quantity and weight). Oh, I forgot to mention the avocado... Brilliant!  Such a great value,  too at $8,50.  My new healthy diet is rocking!!  Thanks to the Big O!

38GHhLiwmtQEiMvjEGzl0w.text: Airport and Pizza.  Two words that seemingly don't go together.  Who hasn't experienced scary airport food at one time or another?  Well, thanks to the new LGO in the airport, that is a thing of the past.  Airport + LGO Pizza = YUM!  :)  While I am aware that LGO has plenty of other great things besides pizza, (breakfast, sandwiches, burgers...) once I saw the wood-fired oven I knew I had to have one.  I chose the basic cheese pizza, which was anything but plain.  Perfectly cooked with a crisp yet somewhat chewy crust and a blend of bubbling savory cheeses.  Large enough to share, but I am not ashamed to say I ate every last bite!  Really?  A wood-fired oven in the airport?  I may have to travel more often...

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ARxHVFyd8DQrGdDqBy8OXQ.text: Breakfast in airport is typically a nasty affair.   But this has to be one of the top places to get a breakfast at an airport.  Fresh eggs to order with bacon? Fresh toast? Real fruit to accompany it?   Yes please.  Is it the best breakfast EVER? No. But it doesn't need to be. It's airport food. And quite good at that. Definitely worth seeking out when you're waiting for your flight. Well worth it.

6BgpN0UH9OtDeqZ1XYnPlQ.text: Morning OJ?? Yes please!! I wish I would've had an appetite for something else. However, next time I will definitely make La Grande Orange my breakfast at the airport spot!! Just remember its past Security Check!!  Oh and I must mention that they always deliver AMAZING Service!!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh squeezed OJ!!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Grande&#39;s goodies!!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fpE2a06j0SwlebjajFaCEA.text: Kale and quinoa salad. Whoa. Dark leafy greens in an airport?!   This was my favorite airport meal ever, and one of the best salads I've had out in awhile. The produce is fresh; the dressing is bright and flavorful, and the quinoa is perfectly cooked. Yes!!!!!

hREomIBh7XAkgDl0pzxqjQ.text: Excellent Margarita pizza! We look forward to it when in Phoenix airport. Try it; you'll like it!

ZDX-aE87qf922wdDru951A.text: Yay for healthier airport food! I admittedly didn't love what I had but they had options that I loved so I'm still giving them 3 stars. I had the egg white omelet with turkey, and then fresh salsa with cherry tomatoes and avocado on the side. The salsa was great, the omelet was greasy and needed salt. However, when do you get an airport restaurant that offers eggs and breakfast food all day? I was just happy to see something besides burgers, bars and pre-made sandwiches. So I can't complain. Plus they had a great selection of healthy desserts on display. (Depends on what your definition of healthy is I guess- gluten free, things like that)

ufRtHwWdgNY7FZL3dOLgmA.text: I am stuck in the airport so I decided to have dinner. I have to say that I never expected a pizza to be good at the airport. This one was really good. They use local items and I was pleasantly surprised!!!

8et2NsIhNNp-qnDDxRUIAA.text: I defy you to find a better dining option in any airport - seriously.  While I'm an unabashed fan of LGO I have to say I'm shocked to see how well the quality carries over to this location and as a frequent traveler I only wish other airports maintained such high standards for their dining options.  Had the Red Velvet Cupcake, Oatmeal Butterscotch Cookie, and Giandujia Croissant this time around and as usual everything was high quality while service is every bit up to snuff with the original location.  The best part?  No price hike for the airport location.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GDCk54gQenbnU25Ngmqm8w.text: More miss than hit...  Coconut cupcake: 0/5 Horrible. cake part has no flavor, icing on top tastes like 95% butter and 5% cream cheese... YUCK!   Blackberry & Almond Dumpling: 1/5 The flavor of the 10% that had any blackberry and almond (which as only on the very bottom) was perfect... but that left 90% of the pastry that was simply bread with no flavor.  Strawberry Crostada: 1/5 took one bite, stopped there. tasked bad  Apple Crostada: 3/5 Very good flavor, needs 2x the apples in it to make it enjoyable  Blueberry Crostada: 5/5 FINALLY something I thought was worth buying, and I enjoyed it!  I could taste blueberry the whole time and there were enough actual blueberries!

UUQS5zkvnBn8F5HDEYUvXQ.text: Oh yum... The green chili hamburger is sooo tasty and served with French fries! Now to indulge in the decadent chocolate brownie!

GrEXPX8yHiKTzvifYqvaow.text: RE: Employee Joshua 322446's customer service skills suck. He was working the cash register on April 10th taking orders. We walked up and did not get a welcomed greeting which is basic customer service in any establishment. Instead we received a stale faced employee who obviously hates his job. He should be working the bathrooms instead of the cashier.  Besides the above, food here is great!

s8iDl67Gh_V0lEZADTXf2g.text: After a flight from Seattle, we had about 2 hours until our flight to El Paso, so we grabbed some food at La Grande Orange.  My wife, who had dined here before, had a tuna salad sandwich which she said was delicious.  I had the Cubano which was equally tasty.  When we have a stop in Phoenix, I know where there is some good food.

eoHsM0nj23HLpcl40b1XUA.text: I happened to go here on the first day it opened, 10/6. For an airport place, for a first day, and for a duplicate of a place with quite a reputation, for once I was not disappointed!  I was a little frantic and running late for my flight, so I could not get a cooked meal. Rest assured, the friendly staff pointed me to the very well stocked cold case and I was able to get a tasty side of mixed fruit with creme fraiche for $3. There were fresh strawberries, grapes and something else, I forgot already, oops. There were definitely other choices in that cold case that I will be back for next time. The line was quick, smiles all around, and for once I got to eat something I didn't regret before flying! I have a feeling next visit will give me enough of an experience to merit the 5th star. No complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QAN_kjaW0MaARK3jgytiaA.text: At Phoenix (yes, right now) for a brief 1.5 hour layover between Chicago and Burbank (CA). Famished, I got off the plane in search for some good grub. I'm not a fan of "local" airport food because generally the food is overpriced and subpar in taste and quality. Thus, I searched for  McDs (or Burger King...something familiar). Didn't find any around gate D.   At first I was attracted to the smell of the wood oven pizzas. I asked the cashier lady - "How big is the pizza?"   "10 to 11 inches - it comes in 8 slices." There was no way that I was going to be able to finish that all by myself. Searched around the long list of menu behind each cashier (4 of them in total), standing behind the long counter. Get this - they were serving Eggs (breakfast style) during lunch.   Anyhow, long long story short, there were several 2 things that impressed me about this joint:  1) Food - I sampled the A-Z cookie and ordered the Tuna Salad. The Tuna Salad was one of the best I've ever tried ...EVER. It had thin thin slices of granny smith apple and the tuna wasn't overly dosed in mayo. It was really good. I paid $7.95.   2) Service - I'm not exaggerating or kidding when I say this - the service here is up there...better than Starbucks during its heydays.  While waiting for my food, I was asked (very politely) by 5 different employees, "Have you been helped?"   As soon as I finished my meal, a server-girl came up to my side and asked if she can take my plate away.   Let me make it clear - this place looks and feels like low-key, but serves and acts like 5-star hotel.   Anyhow, if you every fly through Phoenix (Gate D area), definitely try La Grande.

TZkGGwxlBCZT0gNj-6Sisw.text: Airport food typically sucks, but there are a few airports that are starting to let in local credible eateries.  La Grande Orange provided me one of the best breakfast burritos I've ever had.  I had to pinch myself that I found this place in an airport.

OxPB6EYtklXO_UkNWlaW8Q.text: I have never been to a LGO. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. They made some great suggestions and made sure I knew all of the options. The dining room staff member seemed to really enjoy what he was doing, kept all the tables clean and worked very fast and efficiently. The cookies are HUGE and tasted great and fresh. The burger is more of a slider when it comes to size. So you may consider getting a side. Most of the guests I saw in the dining area ordered freshly made pizzas that looked outstanding! I would stop by here again when visiting the airport!

bm14DEs0Wzw0Ug_Qz3GsBg.text: LGO - I love and trust you but today you let me down.  Running lye for a flight and willing to pay $12 for a BLT since you usually rock it.  Now I'm stuck on a plane with a slimy tomato, paper thin bacon, and just enough green spread on the bun to give the illusion of guacamole. The lettuce was extraordinary in quality and quantity.  You dropped the ball today. :-(

ClOaBw8-rGDrFxQXejpKMQ.text: Food is great and healthy... and it's in an airport! Five stars for the food and three stars for the confusing ordering (nobody knew where to stand to get in line or where to wait for food). I had the kale and quinoa salad, which was great and fresh.
