At first, I was nervous because the salad was pre-made and self serve from a fridge; that turned out to be no problem (though I was there at the end of lunch time so perhaps the salads taste less fresh at other times). My husband had the guacamole BLT and he liked it; it was nicely toasted and there was a decent amount of bacon. If I am back in this airport, I will definitely go there again.

eY3ur7QE7_ocGYGyBVUsOQ.text: I've been going here since before I moved to Arizona 5 years ago. The food is so high quality and fresh, it's continued to be one of my favorite places in the valley. I just so happen to work right down the street now, so I probably go here a good 1-2 times a week minimum.  My favorite has to be the Ahi tuna sandwhich. It's cooked perfect everytime. I swap out the aolil for some champagne viniagarette and add avocado. Amazing! The baked goods are dangerously good, I'm trying to diet so I won't think too long about them. I recommend this place to everyone I know and they all come back and thank me.

aimlpdEQX2zXqFH77QezyA.text: Had a great  experience last night at the LGO in the airport.  The service was excellent and the food was delicious.   The manager was courteous and efficient as we were ordering oir food.  Great experience.   Would go back again for sure.

xYj3eMmpavQwrZVITFndQQ.text: This is nothing like the LGO in Phoenix.  The food is typical food service airport faire.  Awful.  It is a shame they use the LGO name.  You would be better of eating at McDonalds.

2jwE0ERt10EpiUzwYNDxpg.text: Pizza was just ok, probably should try the sammies next time or the burgers. There aren't a lot of options but I guess it wasn't bad, with water it costs 18 bucks though.

JysEgqDH7mRMEciI7mKEtA.text: Decent food but the value of the product doesn't match the price. I understand it's at the airport but a take out breakfast sandwich has no business being 10.00

gaLycVIAOOJVYDBuw_hCtw.text: Great place! (Even if it wasn't in an airport)  Will definitely stop by again if I fly thru PHX.

XIW-CAOxnuhWKvMwl8bkNg.text: You guys just lost $20.00 in Business by not opening ON TIME at 5 AM!!  We had a flight to catch, and had to leave!!  We even knocked on the glass, but your staff could care less!!  I guess it's a good thing, because your overpriced Kale Salad is getting Smaller & Smaller!!

cZUMpz8TjQqrIkCMqh1Eig.text: The food is great, especially for fast food at the airport. The salad was so fresh. The lines were long but worth the weight. I think they do a great job representing the LGO. So you should go if you are in the airport.

T-vc4ZAncdKd4JyYRKBfAA.text: An extremely busy airport restaurant, but for good reason!  It has the LGO quality that we all crave, with fresh, local ingredients. It is truly a taste of home away from home, which makes traveling seem less sterile and dull. At breakfast, I recommend the commuter sandwich, it is easy to eat while you are sitting and waiting at the gate, and the english muffins are amazingly good. LGO is revolutionizing the airport food industry, and giving the Phoenix airport a good rap in the process. Take note, other airports! Real food is possible!

jkSrKI3wBTJ1mFwvtLYWiQ.text: I travel every week and hope to get the D gates at PHX so I can get my gluten free cookie from LGO.  The variety of food and baked goods is great for an airport.  The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is that sometimes the wait times for food is a little long for the busy/always late traveler.

74o96zFdAPK4DSYaMFIFBg.text: The Sky Harbor has many great options for food and this place is no exception. They do pizza, sandwiches, burgers, and salads. I was feeling pizza and I ordered the "Fallen Angel". It came with sausage, fennel, onions, mozarella and red sauce. The pizza was well cooked with a nice chew and the pizzas are single serving. I was impressed.

XZgv6gQ53WYsRuu_fHjEIA.text: Eating healthy is hard.   These guys had good turkey sandwich with avocado.  Large sandwich for the dollar considering airport overhead costs.   $10.

qr5qPhcCkq_ZuD5cNsgVow.text: Outstanding.  I had the chickpea lettuce wraps, huge and awesome, plus better yet the kale & quinoa salad.  That is to die for.  I am in airports multiple times a week this place is the best.

naPQahBrLAqqz1x6OHOJsA.text: Ok--It's airport food! You sort of expect it to be grossly overpriced, nasty tasting and surly service.   If that's your expectation, you're going to be disappointed.   Good food, moderate prices, and very friendly customer service. We got a chance to visit with Chauncy, who interrupted his lunch break to make sure our order was progressing properly. He's VERY proud of his place and justifiably so.   Green chili burger is PERFECT!  Just the right amount of heat and seasoning. Hot, crispy fries, all cooked to order.  All in all, excellent experience.

6zviN-cgTQWTfktdWAtF3A.text: OMG!  This doesn't taste like airport food!  Friendly, fast service and EXCELLENT food!  Try the green chili burger! It's great!  And you might get to meet Chauncey who really takes pride in this restaurant!

qsfru2OSSYDX571HyL2w3g.text: I have wanted to try LGO for some time now, and made plans to have it for dinner before I flew out last week. I found it at Gate D and was pleased at all of the stations and options they have - I'm pretty sure they offer their full menu, or pretty darn most of it. I had a glass of wine and the Gladiator pizza, and I grabbed a cookie for the flight. It took about 10 minutes for the pizza to be ready and I had to wait for it to cool down since it was piping. I really enjoyed it and their sourdough crust is a unique touch. My experience makes me definitely want to make it out to their restaurant.

cd4meD3b5h1pcXJNCU1cqw.text: Yummy kale quinoa salad!  Excellent options, friendly service and delicious.  Did not try the pastries as I'm eating gluten free these days, but they looked really good!

sUxfQxuChZ5NtrQduQAgyQ.text: This is easily the best airport food I've ever had. The kale salad was fresh, well-balanced, delicious, and filling. I could barely even believe it. If you have to get a meal in the airport, make the trek from whatever terminal you're in over to La Grande Orange!

eps_Rgj3dIH6K1hIJmZXvg.text: I'm so bummed out about this place. It used to be my favorite restaraunt in terminal 4 at sky harbor  I would walk from the A gates to the D gates just to get the mouth watering salmon salad or the Croque Monsieur sandwich. But after today I won't come back. I've walked the distance the last few times and each time being disappointed with the menu items. Apparently they have changed the items and now it's a bunch of chicken and tuna salad whatever, sandwich, salads etc. Ho hum. I still give it a three star because the service is fast and the items they do serve are ok.

iCveZgBRChT9invtph-TDQ.text: This may be more of a tip than review, but I am here.   The food is pretty good.  They make fresh sandwiches and have a to order menu,  go with the fresh salads and sandwiches, this helps a lot,  Wine are meh.  Airport food but certainly edible. Seating is a premium mostly because of the tight seating at the gates.

vpkLk19FGebgGF71bd6QRA.text: I will give this place it's props.    A lot of healthy options.     We got the chicken Caesar salad and a pepperoni pizza.    The pizza was awesome.    The salad was great.   Fast and on the spot service.     Expensive though.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7mKm-X8TOhORwsrMc4Gn8A.text: Great place for a bite in the airport! Food is fresh and the oatmeal power bar is the bomb!

SCFpO3DgK-_DF0vjLs6Wzg.text: I've only been to the regular one once, but the one at the airport, multiple times. This place is a great solid choice for almost any type of person, regardless how picky they are.  Very popular local choice!   I'll be back again next week!

eFqyUlvo2D8xzws92gufdA.text: Quick plane change at Phoenix and the closest food spot near Southwest was La Grande Orange. I didn't eat that morning so I was pretty hungry but I didn't want something terribly unhealthy because my friend and I had a big night out later that evening.  There were so many choices here... do I get a sandwich? A wrap? Sushi? Pizza? Pastries (which looks super delicious?!?) Then I saw the "Zuni burrito" which pretty much looked like a healthy breakfast burrito.  WOW! This was the best healthy breakfast burrito I ever had in my life! It had potatoes, tofu, greens, and great seasoning. I was pleasantly surprised with each bite. WOW!  What a great highlight in my many stops in the Phoenix airport! Haha.

YixYmLfgUGMqojOghqudow.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I chose this place for a pre-flight meal. Out of their extensive menu, I chose the margherita pizza and waited the 10 minutes the cashier said the pizza would take.  The pizza was delicious! Super fresh and straight out of the pizza oven visible from the counter. It tasted homemade-an unexpected and pleasant surprise inside of an airport.  The biggest con is the extremely limited seating. Although to be expected, I had to make a mad dash at the first sign of someone starting to clean up and leave, and even then a woman gave me a snarky look and took the table I was waiting for.

K1DYzK4Cnloh8hhNNgaqEQ.text: We ended up eating at LGO twice at the Phoenix airport during our trip. Both times the sandwiches were very fresh and filled with meat and ingredients. The turkey stack sandwich was very filling with mounds of turkey breast, avocado, tomatoes, on a multigrain bread. The open-faced chicken salad sandwich easily had over a cup of filling in it and served on grilled multigrain bread.  The cost of the sandwiches I thought was very reasonable for the quantity, quality, and being served at an airport.   The grab and go case offers a quick convenience for travelers on their way to their next destination.

fPf4riLLxe3tHeS0v_4cbw.text: Really enjoyed the Mother Earth pizza. I wanted something plant based/vegan so I requested no cheese. The chef came out and asked me if I would like marinara sauce, since this pizza is usually not made with sauce. I said yes and thanked him for the suggestion. The pizza was so flavorful and had a variety of fresh vegetables. Best meal I've had in an airport in a long time!

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother Earth pizza- no cheese add marinara :)

9E12RVBuQNPZY0ZGfq2Mog.text: I had been dreading coming to the airport and finding out that LGO had a location made me feel better. While our flight wasn't in section D, we had enough time to kill so we scrambled on down. I ordered the commuter sandwich and the Havana latte. My latte was divine - sweet and tasty.  The sandwich was so large we could have shared. Their homemade English muffins are to die for and I could have just eaten that.   My husband ordered a Caesar salad. The salad was meh. There were tons of to-go salads in the display case and my husband figured that's what they were - to-go salads. Since we were sitting down and eating he thought they would make the salad fresh and bring it out on a plate. Nope. The employee grabbed a box and handed it to my husband. There wasn't a lot of salad in the large box and the crotons were soggy from being inside the box.   Overall, the freshly made items were delicious and the bakery case was full of tempting treats. If I come back through the airport, I'll definitely be grabbing a latte and sweet treat.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Commuter sandwich and a Havana latte.
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Storefront

YaLFIq1dxdUMvC-JvURa8w.text: Was in Terminal 4 and only had limited time to pick something up for dinner to munch on the plane, and after wondering around trying to figure out what I wanted (Yes terminal 4 has plenty to choose from, but also once you past the security check ins, go check out the other gates, they too have plenty to choose from as well) I saw that La Grande Orange was in my area, now I have been wanting to try them for a while now, so I thought this must be a sign to try them out now!  I ordered this Thai Princess Chicken Salad (not sure if that is the correct name, but remembered that it does have the word Princess in it) that had mixed greens, red onions, cilantro (my fav ingredient in the world) spicy peanut dressing/sauce, tender diced/sliced chicken breast, diced red peppers. OMG this salad was amazing! Loved it! Wanted more!  Can't wait to try La Grande Orange in the valley now!

-Tlm92A482wHE7dYMnyV3Q.text: I had a flight delay and wandered around until the pastry case caught my eye. I ordered the smoked salmon salad. It was pre arranged. I was shocked at how amazingly delicious it was. I want to fly back just to eat it again.  I got two cupcakes for dessert (because that's how I roll) and they were not as impressive. I had red velvet and coconut and both were bland and dry.  Next time I will try a scoop of gelato. I miss you salad....

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grapefruit sunrise juice and veggie sandwich

UT_V1zcj5_kW78CCfgJX3w.text: How refreshing to eat some good airport food.  Great turkey salad and awesome Marg pizza. Not sure what the "premium cheese" is but it's divine. Yum.  Would have gotten 5 stars if tables were cleaned.  You're almost there!

6NdyTTW2pwi2oAWf_uYyJA.text: So fun, and so crowed. The cactus sugar cookie is delicious! Very good service and quick despite the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2ZKfBMAwsgXQbTycnY9_xA.text: Excellent sandwich for my husband (the Cuban) and I had a perfect salad. I have lots of food allergies and the gal who took my order even turned around and made sure the other lady that was going to make my salad did it correct. Perfectly fresh and fast. Very appreciative!!

e-IoOL0w57nUKRAW9T_utQ.text: I was quite impressed with this 'Airport Restaurant'. I never would expect anything more than 3 stars during a layover. We had a 4 hour flight and when we landed at our layover in Phoenix, we were starving.   We stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a go, seeing how crowded it was. There were plenty of other restaurants but I was sure this was the one.   We tried the California Burger, the breakfast burrito called the Zuni Burrito and lastly, the chocolate chip cookie with sea salt.   The California burger was perfect. The fries it came with were nice too. The burrito however was just average. It was a bit flavorless actually. I thought the hot sauce they provided with it would add more flavor, but sadly that was not the case. And the chocolate chip cookie was massive and amazing. I wish I could have one right now!

PVzRSf1k9sKwZcl10_LZmA.text: Now don't get me wrong this isn't like going to the LGO in Phoenix (which is amazing) but it's super convenient that it's located in the airport.  I travel a lot so it's nice to be able to get off the plane when traveling back home and grab a salad and drink to go.  Personally I really like the Kale and Quinoa salad but I'm sure other prepared salads are just as tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love that it&#39;s easy to get an LGO salad on the go

Oa08f2ZKKM7me9kvfJ6cQQ.text: Whenever I'm departing from the D gate this is my go to coffee stop. My drink is the Havana Latte and by no meals is it healthy ...BUT...for a guilty pleasure drink that always does the trick you won't be disappointed!   Not the biggest fan of the food but it's all made to order and tastes good...but it's just not my jam.

5hPNoC0oPTAnhFvn9G679w.text: First off, amazing orange juice.  Though, if you messed that up and called yourself "The Big Orange," full stop.  Drop out now.  No need to, though, because this tasted freshly squeezed with the perfect flavor and texture.  The Zuni breakfast burrito I had was very good as well.  Not mind blowing, but solid for airport food.  Speaking of which, LGO is a great alternative to your typical airport fare.  With a wide variety of menu items for virtually any time of day, this was a pleasant departure from most terminal grub.

a8ol_nUtrmA4LOU3wpBrmg.text: Had the pizzeria chop at the airport on my way out of town, then again Saturday at the 40st location.  The pre packaged salad was every bit as fresh and delicious.  Awesome. Had a Gladiator pizza on Saturday also.  Don't forget the egg.  This place continues to provide great flavors and a consistently high delivery each time I go there.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizzeria Chop.  How does a pre packaged salad compare?  Unbelievable, that&#39;s how.

BszOT7jOlQ2V7P6XeL3vBg.text: One of the better restaurant options in the entire Airport. The pizza is thin crust and very very yummy. I wouldnt be able to tell that my pizza came from an airport restaurant.   Will be coming back here during my PHX layovers.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gladiator pizza- shoulda took the pic before I address cheese and red peppers lol

HRq7bOy9vlDM2VdAuqD72A.text: Scotty hands down is the best pizza maker. I'm a pizza nut that can eat pizza every day, but good pizza. I'm love the Rocketman it has veggies and the way Cory makes is unreal - LGO is my favorite PIzza - there are some great other places but I keep coming back to LGO

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OUJhYt0SZveiHtsvXTDndw.text: Salads always taste fresh and are full of flavor. One of the better and healthier options for food at terminal 4 of the Phoenix airport.  It's my go-to place when i'm waiting at a D gate.

kXgWUgGWzeKmPqYJ0Hex9g.text: Snagging a meal before a flight can often be a pain, because the food is often overpriced, low-quality or both. Luckily, La Grande Orange offers a variety of pizzas, salads, and sandwiches at (relatively) reasonable prices. I grabbed a kale salad between flights, and it was pretty good! The pizza also looked quite tasty, but takes more time because you have to wait for it to bake.   There is a fair amount of seating, which makes this place a particularly convenient stop if you have a Phoenix layover.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale Salad

kOoQHuARoQ6KomCCvjqv8w.text: It's Airport food, but it is definitely above average. Very creative and delicious salads. Fast, convenient, and a nice assortment of healthy choices.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa and Kale Salad
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TFmJhcTse4nZMJ7OdHIiyA.text: Chickpea lettuce wraps were good, but also VERY spicy. I also got a latte with soy milk which was delicious. 4 stars just because I was not prepared for the level of spicy that the chickpeas lettuce wraps were and they were almost impossible to pick up and eat. I ended up eating them like a salad. Definitely better than the average airport meal.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chickpea lettuce wraps and a latte (with soy milk). Chickpea lettuce wraps are VERY spicy, so be prepared!

45viInJlDl-Zz2NfIi2RCA.text: Normally "airport food" and "good" don't go together, but La Grande Orange at Phoenix Sky Harbor is your best bet for airport dining.  They stress quality in their food, using more natural ingredients and providing healthier options.  They make their pizzas from scratch which are made to order in their wood fired oven, unless you want to pick one up already made and heated.  They also have an array of pre-made salads and sandwiches, as well as a menu where you can order something freshly made.  Lots of variety.  Vegetarian and vegan friendly too.  Breakfast served until 5:00PM.  Service is fast.  There is a seating area out front but hard to find a table.  Yes, it is quite pricey, but what can you expect from being trapped in an airport.  At least spend it on good quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother Earth Pizza: $16

ObOhOm23ZI4I3ua_giehmQ.text: I ordered a cheeseburger (sans cheese) that came with fries, and cost $12.  That's about the same price you would pay in the restaurant, so not a bad deal.  The food was pretty good, I really loved the fries!  However, the meat patty on the burger was soooo thin.  I'm not a large person, but that burger still did not fill me up.  On the plus side, some of their tables have plugs built in, which is really convenient to charge your devices while you're eating your meal!

iUdp8oWxHW6cYjqCpqSq9g.text: I came to this trendy marketplace/restaurant after an incredibly unsatisfying meal. It did the trick in satisfying my hunger but was far from perfect.  The servers were all extremely friendly and were accommodating as I ordered a lettuce-wrapped green chile burger and subbed green beans as my side. The burger itself was average and the chiles didn't pack much flavor other than intense heat. I didn't hate it but it wasn't anything to call home about. The green beans were tossed in garlic olive oil and were outstanding - win for Team Orange!  Needless to say, I ordered a drink to accompany my entree and went with the a tasty $7.25 house IPA the server recommended. When I initially asked the server what drinks they had she told me about their beer selection. I only found out *after* paying for my IPA that they had $5 glasses of wine. When I politely (I promise, I was nice) brought it up with her she said, "oh, I just don't like wine myself so I don't really think to tell people about it." I didn't think a drink selection could be so complicated. I know that this is a small gripe, but it's annoying for a penny-pincher like me.  Overall, I'd be willing to give La Grande Orange one more go if I'm back in the PHX terminal.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Finally got some wine!
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trying to be healthy?
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer here!

DLpE2p4gqDebwf9s2vtDZw.text: Best airport food ever located in the D Gates for Southwest. If you have time, it's worth the walk.   I've been to the La Grande Orange restaurant in Pasadena and it was amazing.   This airport version was just as good. The Kale and Quinoa Salad is sooooooo good!   And their juices are fresh too!   Couldn't say anything more awesome.   The service was quick and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green chile Burger

Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1AAZkRkuFejK6g22qQ3wrA.text: Pros: This airport is amazing! When I found out they had a LGO here, I had to stop by even though I had just been to the original location yesterday. Fresh squeeze orange juice and an English muffin.   Cons: no merchandise? That's my favorite part of the LGO experience.

rsb7F58SHpwXdmHUTKJm7g.text: Pizza usually takes 10-15 mins to make but it's fresh & hot. Love the kale salad and gotta order an mini AtoZ cookie for dessert! I love that this is location in Terminal D at Sky Harbor. There are always lines here so if you're in a rush to connect to your flight, watch out. It could take 10-15 minutes since most items are made to order.   The grapefruit sunrise bevy is fresh and tart. But the small is a bit pricey for $3.00.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The commuter Sammie with avocado $8.50
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cookies and TO-Go salads

lb0TrlFvSdkkhHHoVJ12fA.text: Food looked tasty, especially the pizza, but I ended up having the burger. It was tasty. The beef really good. I give it a four because I would have preferred a fountain drinks versus bottled and not enough seating available. However I do recommend it.

W-nHXps9dMNJ9Okmd28C-A.text: Vegetarian sandwich on sourdough. Best sandwich ever. Same taste as other location. Only thing is I like it on ciabatta bread but sourdough was good. Airport food has stepped up!

0K8NUUWXFdUugsR2ECQXNA.text: It was an ok experience.  There was a line to order my drink.  Plenty of employees working and looking busy.  Coffee station was a bit dirty, but it was also a busy spot and a lot of people were getting coffee.  The nice thing about it was that you can go back and refill your coffee (since it was self serve).

tmYw-BP6xKRNjD6iMlgJUw.text: Disorderly despite medium amount of customers. Staff give no direction over lines, bring customers in front of others with no explanation to next in line.

C7_azcqOuAakt4vBoLRh3g.text: I love this place. It's probably the best thing that has happened to an airport. Just imagine a great place for food, not expensive, and inside an airport... Usually, you have these chains and generic restaurants in there but not at Sky Harbor. There's an LGO.  There's already an LGO "intersection" in Phoenix with the pizzeria, bakery, burger place and grocery. The food is great there. I compared the prices at the airport with the regular prices and they were the same! You would figured that you would get charged an arm and a leg because it's inside an airport. But no... great food, same price.  I love the English muffins, the Kale salad and pizza. The sea salt chocolate chip cookie is good too. So if you are in Terminal 4 flying Southwest, you can head toward Gates C-D and grab some good food. It's worth the walk... or a ride on the moving walkway. You'll get there in like 2 minutes!  The food is really good, the price is fair, the staff is great, and you have a HUGE variety of items to choose from on the menu. Sandwiches, pastries, pizza, salad, soup, etc. Go try it out next time, and then go to the regular LGO location too. You'll love that you did. :)

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna salad nicoise
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna salad nicoise
Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale salad. That&#39;s what I always get. The quinoa has protein. Next time, tuna!!!

gzt6NoZFpSzDaCpAbxQjsA.text: The customer service was great! The food was just as good! I had the breakfast with eggs and toast. Simple but good!

K6x338BNNsKhFWP03Ju1sg.text: Went here with a friend for dinner, sat at the community table and felt like our waitress was super attentive. The pimento dip and chips was amazing, and our pizza came out with a crispy, thin crust. The gelato looked so good but we were too full! Will definitely be coming back.

giDncFc5lWNLmO5v-fooKA.text: Not your typical nasty airport food, great quality, fresh ingredients really amazing, delicious food.

jeJsnCHzS1RkJxjlSnqruQ.text: LGO is one of my favorite airport food spots with a plethora of grab-and-go options. The kale salad is a definite winner and it's reasonably priced for airport food. The quinoa in it makes it a tad heartier than your typical meatless salad, and the kale is julienned so it's easy to eat. Their champagne vinaigrette is amazing with the parmigiano reggiano cheese and the salad pops with the addition of a handful of red grapes. If you're ever at PHX, it's worth the detour if you have a bit of extra time to spare!

tkzxomk9d56HygAOdaWQpg.text: This is the most horse crap place I've ever been to.  The employees are very uninviting, food is crap and the service is a complete joke for an airport eatery.  Bottomline. Don't spend your money here and hopefully the manager of the place will be kick out on his/her ass

UW66vX65VyfAunTW8jpljg.text: This is the best spot in the Phoenix airport if you're looking for a creative menu. Everything is fresh and tastes good. You can stick to your diet here without having to settle for the usual yogurt cup or pathetic, overpriced salad. They're vegetarian friendly too! I had the tomato soup this time and it was excellent. Everything I've had here has been good.

y7qyjzaKKp4COTcbj8GB_w.text: The cookies here are fantastic.  Big, thick, and delicious.  The employees who work here are typical airport employees though.  overall a good experience.

ICnit9Q0iVMx89j5qYtxgA.text: I love a majority of the restaurants in the Phx Airport, this one is no exception. The concept is fast casual, you place your order with the cashier and sit and wait for your order to be called. It's mix between pre made items organized in a fridge, pizza bar, burger, sandwich bar. I love that they had healthy choices, they had a variety of pre made salads, I got the chicken Caesar and fresh squeeze orange juice for a little over $10. That's not bad for airport in my opinion. It was very fresh, my chicken looked like it was shredded off a rotisserie. Tasted very good and it was a large portion, almost 50% of the salad. The decor here is also sleek and modern. I would recommend this place, great options if you have time to kill or on the go.

UBXO6WTguHC6LX9alWvbzQ.text: Best airport restaurant that I have ever seen.  Something for everyone, my wife had an awesome salad, I had a Cuban sandwich, while my son had a wood-fired pizza.  Clean, affordable, and inexpensive.  They made a mistake on my Cuban and gave us a free red velvet cupcake.  An airport establishment that is concerned with customer service???  What a pleasant surprise.  If you are in this terminal, this is the place to be!

zuDEwyW6Uy0zxqpTZR39gw.text: This place is wonderful! Great food, friendly employees, and I love the environment. My sister and I go here any chance we get! Highly recommend this place.

zXuBuRw25mPTo_oPie29qg.text: Great food, but minus a star for the staff. The cashiers here are lazy, if you're in one line and it is long ask if someone idle can help you, you can order from all registers, they won't flag you down.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Croque Madame (IG name &#34;bbrain&#34;)

JUBFhJPKR85JuK90zxlTYQ.text: If you have time to wait for food, this is definitely the best place to eat for gates C and D!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the waiting. Takes 15-20 minutes for a pizza and about 10 minutes for a sandwich but other than that it is great!  Very good food for an airport and even on its own!!

51xDCyGtAXc4t9d7D_UEdQ.text: eww....delicious burrito......until i pulled a 12 inch long black hair from it! gross. and couldnt return it because we were already at another gate. normally super tasty burrito but not today.

MoCvxM8FibC4IS0MZIZZiw.text: Maybe I caught this place on a bad day? I was not impressed in the least.  First of all, the organization was awful. 2 registers but so many people just standing around waiting for their food that I couldn't tell if they were in line or just waiting. The prepared salads seemed WAY overpriced for the amount of salad you actually got. Also, when asking what type of bakery was in the case, the cashier had to guess for some items which really turned me off from buying a mystery pastry.   I finally ended up with a egg sandwich on an English muffin with avocado. It was tasty, but at 8 bucks, my pockets were not pleased with my choice.  This stop was better than eating at a fast food place, but it was a clustered mess and the prices were way too high for my liking.

a9Ml8jDSUKXayCYXcciyOQ.text: I'm so disappointed in the English muffins now. They used to be hand made so delicious. Now they taste awful. So bummed!

0t7Zao4OyRX6r-QvTrlrlA.text: Best breakfast at sky harbor.  Quick with four registers open. The commuter sandwich is outstanding!

XoDI-MZedhAVO8AH2a-g9g.text: Nothing too special about the turkey wrap. The ingredients were fresh, but seemed like a typical turkey wrap you can buy anywhere.

XNY3LUCvkWByHXQIEw8tBw.text: La Grande Orange has the best food! I got a Mother Earth pizza and I added chicken! Best idea ever! My cashier was very friendly and helpful, thank you David! The manager, Naomi came by and personally checked on us, we chatted about our trip and she offered our son a sample of their gelato, Great customer service and great food makes this the best restaurant in Sky Harbor

Vf_8anzPO8p28VUZltN74g.text: Coffee was great, the girl who checked me out wasn't overly friendly but it might be because they were extremely busy. You can never go wrong with a drink, snack or meal at LGO!

kgBlSIuJlLL0MO7yCHzS6g.text: Highly recommend their Mother Earth pizza and shredded kale/quinoa salad during your next layover. Good portions, fresh ingredients, nice presentation, portable/carry-on friendly. Was greeted upon entry by employee handing out menus. Can also view menu on board behind registers. Don't forget desert! I had an oatmeal butterscotch cookie that was delicious!

K8deh5sTQhNyKbFeyEUmgQ.text: Just about anytime I'm flying on Southwest, I make a point of dining here. Don't judge an airport establishment by its management. When I'm looking for something lighter, I'll go for one of their salads which offer the added benefit of not creating a cloud of odor should you take the leftovers on the plane with you. If the salad is not your thing, try one of their burgers. And make sure you have it served on one of LGO's fresh baked English muffins. The one an only time that I had an issue with the food that had been served, the manager himself brought me the rectified order, apologized for the mistake, and offered me a bakery item. In short, even though this particular LGO is managed by HMS, you can expect the same food that you would expect from La Grand Orange in Pasadena and almost the same level of service.

oAQgknSrncRx1ADZdJ66cw.text: Can you ever had a 5 star experience in an airport?  I'm not sure, but the food here comes darn close.  We tried a roast beef sandwich and the chickpea / roasted tomato / lettuce wrap. Both items were very flavorful.  There was a several minute wait for the roast beef sandwich, but it was worthwhile.  The chickpea lettuce wrap had really good flavor, and it was wonderful to eat something that was 1) healthy and 2) vegetarian while in an airport.  It would have been impossible to eat as a wrap without making a giant mess, but I used a fork and knife and it worked out great.  As for the ordering & dining experience... There were several registers scattered around the various counters and they were all staffed, but the throngs of people everywhere made getting to the registers a bit difficult.  I would recommend some crowd control stanchions in front of each register to organize things a bit more (think of the line guides you see at Noodles & Co) and perhaps have some printed out menus as people wait in line.   A sign that says "Any item may be ordered at any register" would be good too - some people were insisting on waiting by the register that was near a "pizza" sign simply because they thought they had to be in that line to order that item, when that wasn't True.   My other comment was that it was hard to find seating - many of the small tables had been combined to form large tables - which in an airport, isn't necessarily a bad thing - given the carry-ons, purses, coats, etc that most people are schlepping around.  We just asked a twosome sitting at a table for 8 if they minded some company.  They didn't, so it wasn't a problem at all.  A couple of other points: -the food was very reasonably priced (given that you're in an airport!) -you can get non-breakfast items in the morning.  I don't know about you, but I don't always want eggs at 10 am...especially if I've been up for 6 hours at that point; that's when I'm looking for lunch.  Le Grande Orange had a great selection of breakfast and lunch items, and all were available to be ordered at 10 am.  The food was 5 star.  The ordering experience (the day that I was there) was a 3 star experience, so it averages to 4 stars.  However, the ordering issues are small logistics problems that can be fixed easily, so I'm not worried about it and I would deal with the hassles again in order the tasty food.  At the end of the day, I will absolutely come to a Le Grande Orange when I'm looking for a good healthy lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of La Grande Orange - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chickpea lettuce wraps...nom nom!

qYo5rz-QTQh6dgJVIOR66w.text: Staff was prompt and helpful even making a salad custom for me.   Very reasonable prices especially at the airport terminal.  A great addition.

WS7GwMzYGUGFVWPJvTQpIw.text: Good food. Good coffee. Friendly service. Had the breakfast burrito & a small drip coffee. A little pricey at $11, but better than the alternatives without having to walk too far from Concourse D in Term 4.

cykM7sl0oHEoZy5Qx3x6zg.text: Great Place! Order the cheeseburger! It's perfectly juicy, crispy, cheesy and with it's crisp cut fries it's the best burger I've had!

4eT0sccrb4qP36lSoezFsw.text: Great salads and unbelievable pizzas. I spend a lot of time in airports and it's very rare to have the same quality food and service at an airport location as the original restaurant. Definitely worth the walk to D gates.

wlvmn4-rr8PZBMeWjV5JTA.text: Stupid a layout for coffee . All they do is sell u an empty cup and then point you to a corner to fill it Only room for 2 people and if they decide to mix it there, you are acrewed. Stupid stupid stupid

KroRWJQe9gxB4gbBawtI2Q.text: We loved this gem of a restaurant!  What a great concept for this type eating establishment located in one of the busiest airports.  Lots of healthy options with a great selection of (not so healthy) yummy baked goods.

KHth_2Ns9nTtPcgRWAXcbA.text: All of you that love this place, seriously?  I've been to the airport location a number of times and always disappointing or bad.  If you want a water, a bag of English muffins, or maybe a cup of fruit then it's fine.  I just ordered eggs, sausage, fruit, and an English muffin.  They weren't scrambled but just one flat thin overcooked egg.  The sausage was disgusting.  So overcooked and hard it clearly came from early early this morning and sat or from yesterday and was warmed.  The fruit cup, different than the prepackaged fruit they sell separately, was dark brown around all the edges.  Look at my other reviews and you'll find that I am always consistent with reviews and give places a second chance.  I've been to their main Phoenix location and the market was great. The food we had their was mildly disappointing to average.  I will not spend another dollar here.  When you leave a review try to forget your perception of the place and how awesome their reputation alone is.  Judge it on the experience.  This place sucks and after multiple times I've solidified that fact.   Colleagues have told me the same but they don't yelp.  Many of these popular local restaurants that have airport locations use airport employees because it's cheaper.  The exception that I'm aware of is Cartel Coffee.  They employ their own employees that have been properly trained and care about the end product.  This place just isn't worth the great tasty muffins.

GZUE5-DtpNVjDcUxFGG5Ng.text: Good place go grab a bite to eat at Phoenix airport.  This is a small chain (mainly in So Cal).  Place can be crazy though since there are not many dining options at the SW gates...

OM-qgH-aol-6bSZZ3SVU5w.text: Things seems to have gone downhill. In the morning this place is disorganized and wait times for food can be too slow. I find the food to just okay and nothing like their restaurant in Arcadia. I now only come here if I am desperate.

OGdX71POVXBzRlLcnCWjtw.text: I had the best experience at the airport LGO....far superior than the 50+ experiences I've had at the 40th street location.  The staff at this location are amazing, very attentive and provided excellent customer service...specifically Steve who made sure my order was just right after I made a request at the register.  It's hard to make an airport experience great, but they did it!

fnEVUWy3qj1wvGBl1vw7ug.text: I've eaten here twice. It is rather good food for airport food. While the items themselves aren't that memorable (burgers, sandwiches, etc.) the ingredients seem really excellent and the quality is high. If I need to eat at the Phoenix airport, this is where I'll go.

tjv7Ua947mILxiY27GAQLQ.text: Absolutely horrible.  Did take out chopped salad was not worth $11.00.  Small portion and the pizza was ice cold and was like as thin as a piece of paper maybe 3 pieces of the schrieners chicken sausage on it.  Pathetic.  $30 for that meal Are you kidding me. My girlfriend and I arent even full.  We had to go get more food.  Never ever go back.  Get your shit together!!

4C8VkHtmJPZie2qPLfDh3g.text: These guys are amazing! I usually grab a bite here when I pass through the Phoenix airport because they offer healthy good food choices. The last time I was passing through, I didn't think I'd have time. I asked at the air carrier desk and was told boarding was delayed by 40 minutes so I went and placed an order. While waiting, they started boarding my flight (air carrier was mixed up and referenced wrong flight), so when I asked how quick it would be ready, Ski (?) told me just to board and they'd deliver my food. Found this hard to believe as they were very busy, but I trusted him. Before the plane closed the door, the flight attendant came to me with a bag from La Grande Orange withy meal - a veggie panini sandwich that was delicious! I think they need to start promoting that service of meal delivery on the runway. It was an awesome experience and so impressed with Ski's degree of customer service.

emr-6g-clkyPjXzdfbmbMw.text: Great food, especially for an airport. After a week of traveling, I was ready for a light fare, and the Shangri-La vegetarian burger fit the bill. The great part was that it was fresh made, not just a frozen veggie pattie warmed up.
